loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado y está acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad.

Marisol se levanta junto a su esposo a las 5:30 AM  para realizar sus actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y el cuido del ganado.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar la tierra y transportar la cosecha.
Sus planes son comprar más ganado con las ganancias de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marisol, 46, studied up until 6th grade and is married. Her husband works in agriculture and they have a son who is 10 years old.

Marisol gets up with her husband at 5:30 am to complete the necessary daily tasks for their agriculture work and looking after the livestock.

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy an ox yoke so that they can plough the land and transport the harvest. Her plans are to buy more livestock with the earnings from her work.

loans.use: to buy an ox yoke to plough the land and transport the harvest.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un señor de 59 años, él vive junto a su esposa y un nieto en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.

Luis a pesar de su edad él todavía tiene muchas energías para el trabajo que realiza, él es apicultor desde hace 25 años, le gusta esta actividad y le encanta trabajar con las abejas ahora, al principio le costó familiarizarse con ellas, porque es un trabajo que requiere de mucha precaución y además cuando es tiempo de producción de miel se debe manejar con mucha delicadeza las cajas para no alborotar las abejas. 

Pues por los años de experiencia en  esta actividad Luis también trabaja con otros productores de miel, además de generar más ingresos, él también comparte su experiencia con ellos. Pues para seguir aumentado la  producción es necesario darles comodidad a los animales, entonces Luis se ve en la necesidad de elaborar más cajas para colmenas, y es por eso que está buscando un prestamo que le servirá para comprar materiales y todo lo necesario para elaborar las cajas. Pues la meta de Luis es seguir incrementado la producción de miel,  para generar más ingresos  y así darle una mejor vida a su esposa y nieto.
texts.en:
Luis, 59, lives in the community of Suchitepéquez with his wife and grandson.  Despite his age, he still has a lot of energy for his work.  He has been a beekeeper for 25 years, an activity he likes, and he enjoys working with the bees now.  Initially, it cost him to familiarize himself with them because it is a job that requires a great deal of precaution and when it is time for honey production, one must handle the boxes very gently so as not to disturb the bees.

So, with his years of experience in this activity, Luis also works with other honey producers.  In addition to generating more income, he also shares his experience with them.  To keep increasing production, it is necessary to provide comfort to the animals, so Luis sees the need to make more boxes for the hives.  For this reason, he is looking for a loan that will help him to purchase materials and everything that he needs to make the boxes.  Luis’ goal is to continue increasing honey production in order to generate more income, and thus provide a better life for his wife and grandson.

loans.use: to make boxes for beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and bricks and to pay for labor

loans.name: Christy Jean

texts.en:
Christy Jean is 24 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Christy Jean has been in this business for 2 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jesa Joy

texts.en:
Jesa Joy is 42 years old and married with two children who are in school. Jesa Joy works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Jesa Joy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ayudar a los más necesitados es un acto que pocos se dedican a realizar, pero Ofelia es una joven que con tan solo 26 años de edad se esfuerza y se ha decidido por emprender en la difícil rama de la medicina. Ella es egresada de la carrera de Tecnología Médica, sin embargo, ahora lucha por obtener el título de licenciada en farmacia. Su único apoyo es su madre y los deseos de superarse profesionalmente provienen de su pequeña hija de 2 años, quien es por quien lucha día a día.

Ofelia solicita el crédito para comprar equipo de laboratorio y poder trabajar en su profesión, esto le ayudará a salir adelante y crecer poco a poco.  Las metas de esta joven emprendedora son terminar su segunda carrera para poder poner su propia farmacia, a la vez que trabaja en su laboratorio clínico.
texts.en:
Helping those in most need is one of the many things that Ofelia strives to do. She is a youth of only 26 years old who has decided to take on the difficult field of medicine. She is s graduate of Medical Technology. However she is now struggling to obtain her diploma as a Licensed Pharmacist. Her only support is her mother and her desire to excel professionally stems from her young two year old daughter who she fights for day by day.

Ofelia is requesting a loan to buy laboratory equipment and be able to work in her profession. This will help her to get ahead and grow little by little. The goals of this enterprising youth are to complete her second degree to be able to open her own pharmacy while she is working in a clinical laboratory.

loans.use: to buy laboratory equipment.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying & selling charcoal in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Bella has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana Don Miguel se prepara para ir a trabajar. Este humilde hombre se dedica, desde hace 35 años, a la labor de zapatero. Todo comenzó cuando desde muy pequeño le ayudaba a su padre en un taller de zapatería, el cual, heredo cuando este falleció. Su trabajo como zapatero le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia y pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija menor. 
Don Miguel solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales que usa para reparar los zapatos de sus clientes y de esta manera cumplir mejor con su trabajo. Las metas de Don Miguel son que, mediante el fruto de su trabajo y sus esfuerzos, su hija logre prepararse profesionalmente. Sus planes futuros son seguir siempre trabajando en su negocio y atender con calidad y calidez a su clientela.
texts.en:
Very early in the morning Don Miguel prepares to go to work. This humble man has worked making shoes for the last 35 years. It all started when as a very young boy, he helped his father in his shoe workshop, which Don Miguel inherited when his father passed away. His work as a cobbler has helped him to get his family ahead and pay for his younger daughter's university studies.

Don Miguel is asking for a loan so that he can buy materials he needs for repairing his clients' shoes and so in this way do a better job. Don Miguel's goals are, through the fruits of his labour and efforts, that his daughter will get her degree. His future plans are to always continue working at his business and assist his customers with quality service and warmth.

loans.use: buy materials for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía de 44 años de edad, es una persona que  estudió noveno grado, sus padres le enseñaron las actividades de la ganadería y la agricultura  y es una persona acompañada, su esposo le ayuda en los trabajos de siembra y del cuido de las vacas que poseen.
		
Rosalía se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas junto a su esposo durante la mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche entre sus vecinos 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una novilla que en un futuro le servirá para producir más leche para el negocio que posee.

Sus planes son compras más animales con las ganancias que obtenga de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 44 years old. She studied up to ninth grade and her parents taught her the farming business.

She is married and her husband helps her sowing and taking care of the cows they own. On the morning they both work the lands and during the afternoon they milk the cows. Then they sell the milk to their neighbours.

Rosalía needs this loan to buy a heifer that in the future will help them produce more milk for her business.

She plans to buy more animals with the money she will make with her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a heifer that in the future will help them produce more milk.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Con el crédito que Blanca obtuvo para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café la producción de aromático grano mejoro de gran manera ya que fue asistido con mucha diligencia. Ella compro fertilizantes, abonos, entre otros con los que protegió y mejoro la producción pagando así mismo la mano de obra para la recolección del grano con el que tuvo excelentes ganancias al momento de su venta y ayudo a captar más ingresos para su familia y hogar para salir adelante. Ella espera que en esta nueva oportunidad sea poyada de la misma forma que con su primer crédito pues en esta nueva temporada quiere pagar la mano de obra para limpiar de maleza y hojas secas la propiedad, aplicar abono, fertilizar la planta y esperar que esta cosecha sea mejor que la anterior de manera que cada cosecha sea mejor que la anterior.
texts.en:
With the loan Blanca took out in order to help her coffee plants, the production of the aromatic grain improved greatly since she was very careful. She bought fertilizer and composts among other things which helped her to protect and improve production, as well as paying for labour for the harvesting. She had excellent earnings after selling and this helped her to take home a bigger income for her family and household to get ahead.

She hopes that with this new opportunity she will have the same support as with her first loan since in this new season she wants to pay for labour to get rid of the weeds and dry leaves off the property, apply compost, fertilize the plants and hope that this harvest will be better than the last so that each harvest will be better than the previous one.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labour to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Famille Matembera Group

texts.fr: Matembera a toujours apprécié la culture du café depuis son jeune âge et a hérité ce champ de ses parents. Ce prêt lui permettra de payer la main d'oeuvre pour les travaux de sarclage. Il espère à la longue se construire une maison d'habitation et satisfaire les besoins vitaux de sa famille. Il est le chef de groupe et pose sur la photo avec son épouse
texts.en: Marembera has enjoyed coffee farming since he was young and inherited this field from his parents. This loan will enable him to pay labour costs for the hoeing. In the long-term he hopes to build a home and provide the vital necessities for his family. He is the leader of the group and is posing in this photo with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for hoeing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Joan has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old, and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
“A big chunk of the Kenyan population are farmers; and by that, I mean [those] people who make a living off of the land; and almost all the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Khadija, a 26-year-old mixed farmer based in Magutu, a remote village in Kerugoya area of Kenya. 

Khadija has a husband, and at home they have one child. For the last 5 years, Khadija has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, eggs and vegetables. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Khadija to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. 

Khadija is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus, increase sales volume. Khadija needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron las actividades de la agricultura y ganadería, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, pero cada uno tiene su propio hogar, pero le ayudan a realizar las labores agrícolas, ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias.

 María, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que desempeña desde hace varios años, lo hace junto a sus hijos, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde, ella se dedica a ordeñar las vacas, para vender la leche entre sus vecinos. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para elaborar quesos y venderlos en los alrededores de su vivienda.

María, planea que con los ingresos que obtenga del comercio de queso, de la siembra, y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca, podrá comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, ya que desea iniciar este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
María, aged 50, grew up with her parents, who taught her about agricultural and livestock activities. She attended school till 9th grade. María is a single mother of two children, who however both have their own homes. Nonetheless, they help her with the agricultural work.

María gets up at 4:30 a.m. to go about her daily activities. She works in agriculture, as she has done for many years, together with her children. In the morning they work the fields and María moves on to milk the cows towards the evening so as to sell the milk among her neighbors.

María needs the money to buy a dairy cow, so that she can make cheese to sell in her neighborhood. She plans to use the income from cheese-selling, from the harvest and the loan money for the cow to buy a grill to make pupusas, as she hopes to start this new line of business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: José Alonso

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, terminó de estudiar bachillerato, está casado y su pareja trabaja como maestra, tiene tres hijos y se encuentran estudiando, además en casa vive la suegra de José.

José se dedica a la ganadería, él compra y vende ganado, ordeña y vende los productos derivados de la leche, ya tiene más de 15 años en este negocio y el lugar donde cuida el ganado está a 400 metros de su casa.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar zacate para el ganado y también para arreglar los cercos del potrero.

Sus sueños son tener más ganado en un futuro y espera darles lo necesario a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and finished his Secondary schooling. He is married and his wife works as a teacher. He has 3 children who are studying and his mother-in-law also lives in their house. José works raising livestock. He buys and sells cattle, milks and sell the products derived from the milk. He has more than 15 years experience in this business and the place where he keeps his cattle is 400 meters from his house.

He needs the loan to buy fodder for his cattle and also to repair the fences of his corral. His dream is to have more cattle in the future and he hopes to provide his children everything they need to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cattle and also repair the fences of his corral.

loans.name: Harlin Arturo

texts.es:
Harlin es un hombre muy honesto, compartido y emprendedor, sale todos los días en su motocicleta a recorrer calles y almacenes buscando vender algunos de sus productos como lo son calzado, ropa general, línea deportiva, surtido escolar, todo aquello que le genere una utilidad y en la cual pueda lograr ganar un cliente que le compre periódicamente.
Su sueño es un anhelo que involucra a su familia y es que quiere llevárselos a una linda playa o a un crucero para pasar unas agradables vacaciones.
Harlin solicita un préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares, calzado y ropa en general, para iniciar una nueva ruta en un pueblo buscando acaparar mercado que le genere buenas ganancias para alimentar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Harlin is an extremely honest, generous, and industrious person. He makes a living by heading out each day on his motorcycle to travel the streets of his city selling shoes, clothing, sportswear, school supplies, and other goods. Harlin's efforts have paid off as he's built a base of customers that buy from him regularly. 

Harlin's ambition is to provide his family a vacation at a beautiful beach or on a cruise ship. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of purchase school supplies, shoes, and general clothing items. This investment will allow him to start selling on a new route, build a new customer base, and earn a steady income that will allow him to reach his goals.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, shoes, and general clothing items.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya viven aparte y son independientes, solo un niño de 10 años vive con ella,

Rosa, trabaja como ama de casa desde hace 5 años, por lo que su madre cuida de su hijo, también  la hija que vive aparte le ayuda un poco.

Rosa, con el crédito comprará cemento, hierro y para pagar la mano de obra que construirá un cuarto, donde pueda dormir ella y su hijo.

En un futuro niña Rosa, planea obtener un crédito más grande, que le permita construir su propia vivienda y así tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She went to school until fourth grade. She is a single mother with 3 children, two of which do not live at home and are independent. The youngest is only 10 years old and lives with Rosa. 

Rosa has been working as a housekeeper for 5 years and for this reason her mother looks after her youngest child. Her daughter that does not live at home also helps her out a little.  

Rosa will use the loan to buy cement and iron and pay workers to build a bedroom where Rosa and her child can sleep.

In the future, Rosa plans to get a larger loan which will allow her to build her own home and therefore provide her and her child with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron and to pay workers to build a room.

loans.name: Mary Group

texts.en:
The lady pictured with her hand raised is Nemzachin, a 54-year-old homemaker. She is the representative of the group ‘Mary’. Nemzachin has four children, and her family lives in Bungmual village, which is situated in the hills of Manipur. She is a reliable person who shows readiness to help others.

She hopes to start a poultry business, as her husband, who has been the only source of income, is now about to be retired from his post. With financial difficulties in the house, she lost the opportunity to achieve her dream business. She came across WSDS providing loans with low interest, which revived her dream.

With the Kiva loan, she is able to buy chickens and start with her dream poultry business. They have enough space in their house compound, which is suitable for poultry. The income from her poultry farm will be use for the education of her daughter and household maintenance. She is indebted to WSDS for being part of building their family.

All the other group members are trustworthy and strive for their business growth through the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
Sanadei, age 31, is a mother with two children. She lives with her husband in a small village in Koraput district of Odisha. Five years ago, she decided to have her own business of selling corn, rice, wheat, and flour, as well as spices. She previously worked in agriculture.

Sanadei gradually excelled at her business by investing several loans. She, along with her group, is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 120,000 INR. She will use her portion as part of her group so that she can buy basic grains, such as corn, wheat and beans, that she can resell.

Her idea is to always maintain her source of income. Sanadei’s goal is to expand her business so that it becomes more profitable. She would also like to purchase or rent a small house to open a small grocery store.

The group is named “Maa Durga Shg” and consists of ten women who sell groceries, milk, vegetables, clothes and basic grains in the same community where they live. The amount of their loan will be invested in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, such as corn, wheat and beans, in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purlins and zinc.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 65, is a sari-sari or retail store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been in this business for more than 30 years. 

Avelina sells various goods like foodstuffs and others to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Avelina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and others. 

This loan will allow Avelina to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and others.

loans.name: Armelie

texts.en:
Armelie is a 41-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Armelie runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been her source of income for more than nine years now. 

Armelie is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, soap and toiletries and others. 

A loan will help Armelie to improve her inventory thus augmenting her sales and income. Armelie’s future plans include the expansion of her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, soap and toiletries and others.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 67-year-old vegetable farmer from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has been in the vegetable farming business for more than 40 years now. This is her source of income. 

Erlinda is asking to take a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. A loan will help her improve her vegetable farming thus augmenting her harvest and yield. Erlidna has hopes of improving her livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
This is Sarlyn. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan which she used to purchase additional grocery items needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children, and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business, if you will lend her 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional inventory of food items, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Sarlyn also operates her direct selling business for additional profit. She dreams that her family will always be happy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items such as toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a 36-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Jasmin runs a small sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her area. This has been her source of income for more than a year now. 

Jasmin is asking to take a loan to buy more inventory to sell like: canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, soap and toiletries, and others. A loan will help Jasmin to improve her inventory thus augmenting her sales and income. 

Jasmin’s future plans include the expansion of her business so that it will generate more income. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell like: canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, soap and toiletries, and others

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 39-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has six children. Jocelyn runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been her source of income for more than 14 years now. 

Jocelyn is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, soap and toiletries and others. A loan will help Jocelyn to improve her inventory, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

Jocelyn’s future plans include the expansion of her business so that it will generate more income. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, soap and toiletries and others.

loans.name: Jorjelyn

texts.en:
Jorjelyn is a 39 year old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has five children. Jorjelyn runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been her source of income for more than 5 years now. 

Jorjelyn would like to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries and others. A loan will help Jorjelyn to improve her inventory, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

Jorjelyn’s future plans include the expansion of her business so that it will generate more income. She also wants to save money to pay for her children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries and others.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn hopes that her business will continue to become successful and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise  needed for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy clothes such as t-shirts, pants, dress etc to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as t-shirts, pants, dress to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. Virgie is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy equipment and materials such as woods, nails, paint etc..

Virgie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials such as woods, nails, paint.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking 36-year-old farmer based in Magutu village, in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She lives with her husband of eleven years and children on a three-acre farm in the village. She makes a living selling vegetables (kale) and poultry. She also has a borehole where she fetches water for both domestic and agricultural use. 

Lucy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With a 40,000 KES loan, she will buy more chickens to add to the eight she already has. Her dream is to scale up her poultry business and have it as one of her main sources of income. 

In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the poultry farm will enable her to repay the loan on time and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and education costs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
“When smallholder farmers come together, they are powerful,” says Jane, a 42-year-old farmer who has a lovely family and lives in the village of Kiamulungu in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. For the past years, Jane has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. 

This has not been a setback because Jane has been making great profits in farming. Kerugoya is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Jane has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming. 

Through the Ngariama self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Jane joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. 

This loan will improve Jane's living conditions and secure the future of her children. Jane has a firm goal to get her project ahead, since she wants to become a successful business owner and guarantee a better quality of life and well being for her family, and she knows that with the Kiva lenders and Juhudi Kilimo, she can achieve all of this and more.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 53 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Alita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alita has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Esta alegre mujer es María, una vendedora de alimentos fritos y jugos, madre soltera muy luchadora, guerrera, que le ha tocado desempeñar su papel de madre y padre dándole una excelente educación a  sus dos hijas.
Toda su vida le ha gustado trabajar como independiente, incluso en situaciones adversas supo salir adelante.
María se encuentra muy contenta y es debido a que su negocio está en crecimiento, tiene más clientes, vende sus alimentos y gusta en el mercado por ello quiere aprovechar el momento y solicitar un préstamo y tú puedes ser partícipe de la evolución de esta empresaria cabeza de familia, prestándole capital para comprar pulpa de fruta y materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
This happy woman is María, a vendor of fried food and juices. She is a single mother, very much a fighter and a warrior who has had to take on the role of both mother and father providing an excellent education for her two children. All her life she has liked to work independently including the difficult times when she has understood how to get ahead.

María is very content and this is due to the fact that her business is growing. She has more clients and she sells her foods and she enjoys being in the market. She wants to take advantage of this moment and request a loan. You can be a participant in the evolution of this enterprising head of family, lending her capital to buy fruit pulp and raw material to make her foods.

loans.use: to buy fruit pulp and raw materials for her food sales.

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es:
Reynaldo es un habitante de San Bernardo y cumple una gran función y responsabilidad en esta zona, desde el año 2010 se desempeña como comerciante mayorista de arroz, una actividad muy demanda pero con muchos inconvenientes, algunos de ellos son los constantes cambios climáticos que hacen que el precio de este grano tan precio y consumido se eleve, otro de ellos son los impuestos que imponen bandas fuera de la ley para operar, pero a pesar de tantas trabas, Reynaldo sigue ejerciendo dicha labor pues con ella ha sacado a su familia delante de muchos aprietos mejorando su calidad de vida y brindándole estudio a su pequeña de 7 años de edad.
Como el negocio de Reynaldo está en crecimiento quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra en grandes cantidades de arroz, a fin de empacarlo y distribuirlo a las plazas de mercado que tienen contrato con él.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a resident of San Bernardo and he has a big role and responsibility in that area. Since 2010, he has worked as a rice wholesaler, an activity that has a lot of demand but a lot of challenges. Some of them are constant weather changes that make the price of this very popular and much consumed grain go up. Another is the taxes that lawless groups charge in order to operate. But despite so many obstacles, Reynaldo continues to do this work. With it, he has gotten his family out of many problems, improving their quality of life and giving his 7 year old daughter an education. 

Since Reynaldo's business is growing, he wants to ask for a loan to buy large quantities of rice, in order to pack it and distribute it in the marketplaces he contracts with.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of rice in order to pack it and distribute it to market places.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El negocio de reparación de motocicletas de Jorge inicio en el año 1983, y hasta ahora lo mantiene, tantos años de experiencia le dan el aval de buenos clientes y de un progreso significativo que bien no termino bien por la cantidad de competencia que hay en la zona.
La herramienta de Jorge lo han acompaño todos estos años y hasta ahora sigue con la misma.
Jorge solicita un préstamo pues necesita cambiar toda su herramienta que ya cumplió un ciclo de uso muy alargado, algunas de su herramienta ya no tienen buen agarre lo que no puede permitirse pues necesita entregar las motocicletas en óptimos estado con cada tornillo bien apretado, con cada pieza perfectamente encajada.
Tu ayuda, permitirá que Jorge siga prestando un excelente servicio.
texts.en: Jorge started a motorcycle repair business in 1983, and has kept it going until now. Many years of experience have given him the endorsement of good customers and substantial progress that he has not yet completed because of the amount of competition in the area. Jorge's tools have been by his side this whole time and he still has the same ones. Jorge is requesting a loan since he needs to replace all of his tools because they've already gone through a very long period of use. Some of his tools no longer have a good grip which is unacceptable because he needs to return the motorcycles in optimal condition with every screw well-tightened and every piece perfectly assembled. Your help will allow Jorge to continue providing excellent service.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer muy trabajadora,  guerrera, toda su vida ha sabido valerse por sí misma, tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la zona de Sincelejo y gracias a trabajos anteriores similares adquirió la experiencia necesaria para tener su propio negocio funcional y estable.
Aida no niega que es una persona humilde, en ocasiones no le da para comprar el surtido suficiente para abastecer su negocio y está consciente de que necesita un gran apoyo para mantener en pie lo que con tanto esfuerzo y tiempo ha consolidado.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de abarrotes, granos, y productos de uso personal con los que abastecerá su negocio.
texts.en:
Aida is a very tenacious and industrious woman who has always known how to provide for herself. She earns a living by running a grocery store in her neighborhood in Sincelejo. Having worked in similar businesses before starting her own shop, Aida and has taken advantage of her experience to build a stable operation and earn a steady living. 

Aida is the first to admit that her resources are limited and that at times she doesn't have the capital to stock her store properly. She recognizes that she needs support to sustain the business that she's built up with so much effort over so much time. Aida is therefore applying for a loan for the purchase of  grocery items, grains, and personal care products to stock his store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, grains, and personal care products to stock his store.

loans.name: Jotham's Group

texts.en:
Jotham is 62 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Jotham has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jotham also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this as it will allow his children to be able to study during the dark hours.

Obtaining this loan means that Jotham's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jaime Andres

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven de tan solo 18 años de edad, lleno de ímpetu, y ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a la reparación de celulares, tables y computadores, y adquirió sus conocimientos gracias a unas clases a las que se sometió.
Sus ganas de progresar no cesan, el solo hecho de estar operando a tan corta edad no le atemoriza y no quiere descansar hasta consolidar un loca y tener gente trabajando, pero sabe que primero tiene que esforcé mucho y trabajar largas horas para lograr ese sueño.
Jaime solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos de tabletas y computadores, y se compromete a pagar cumplidamente pues sabe que le están dando la oportunidad de crecer y no los decepcionara si apoyan su propósito.
texts.en:
Jaime is just 18, but very dynamic and full of ambition to succeed. He took classes to learn to repair devices such as cell phones, tablets, and computers, and now has a repair business. 

Jaime's ambition is tremendous, but his youth prevents him from feeling fear or hesitating as he builds his business. He doesn't want to stop moving forward until he's able to set up a store and hire a staff to help him reach his goals.  

Jaime is applying for a loan for the purchase parts for tablets and computers, and is committed to make his loan payments on time. He knows that a loan represents and opportunity to grow his business, and he's determined not to let down those who give him this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase parts for tablets and computers.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
La compra de un Horno se ha convertido en la obsesión y el deseo de Claudia, una microempresaria humilde pero muy trabajadora, que emplea hasta de 10 horas diarias en su trabajo con tal de generar dinero para el mantenimiento de sus dos hijos que cursan actualmente la básica primaria.
Claudia solicita un préstamo con mucha urgencia, pues el horno sería de gran ayuda en la elaboración de nuevos platos en su portafolio, también la agilidad de preparación de las comidas. 
Como no cuenta con muchos recursos y a mayoría de dinero recibido es para el gasto de su familia solo le queda un crédito para comprar este activo y aspira a que esta compra sea el desencadenante de múltiples sucesos positivos en su empresa como lo son, el aumento de cliente, aumento de  ingresos, mejores condiciones de vida etc.
texts.en: Buying an oven has become Claudia's desire and obsession. She's a humble but very hard-working entrepreneur, who currently spends up to 10 hours a day on her job to make money to support her two children that are currently in elementary school. Claudia is requesting a loan with great urgency, because an oven would be a big help in making new dishes for her menu, as well as speeding up food prep. Since she doesn't have lots of resources and most of what she makes goes towards family expenses a loan is her only option to purchase this asset and her goal is for this purchase to be the first link in a chain of positive steps for her business, like a higher amount of customers, higher income, a better standard of living, etc.

loans.use: To purchase an oven.

loans.name: Nashon's Group

texts.en:
Nashon is 56 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Nashon has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Nashon also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Nashon's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Jane will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Jane plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Jane’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Kkn27549 Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Everlyne will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Everlyne plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy more land to cultivate.

In total Everlyne’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene 48 años de edad y tiene una educación primaria. Debido a su situación financiera, sus padres no pudieron continuar ayudándola para que asistiera a la secundaria. Ella es madre soltera de tres hijos. El mayor reside en EE.UU. los otros dos viven aun con ella uno trabaja y estudia y el otro le apoya en el campo. Florinda ha estado elaborando viveros de café para la venta y siembra durante 15 años por iniciativa propia. Sus hijos la ayudan a hacer este trabajo. El área donde está ubicada su propiedad es de tres kilómetros desde su casa al cual se traslada en vehículo de paila. Florinda se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para hacer las tareas de la casa y luego desplazarse hasta donde tiene sus viveros y propiedad de café junto a uno de sus dos hijos que viven con ella y dar el mantenimiento que necesitan para retornar al mediodía. Florinda está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos y pagar mano de obra calificada para asistir la propiedad de café y su vivero. Con esto se espera un mejor ingreso para la familia, sin dejar de tener la fe de vender su cosecha a un buen precio para que ella pueda tener éxito y obtener muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Florinda is 48 years old and has an elementary school education. Due to their financial situation, her parents were unable to put her through middle school. She is the single mother of three children. The eldest lives in the U.S and the other two still live with her. One of them works and studies and the other one helps her in the field. Florinda has been developing coffee nurseries for sale and planting for 15 years under her own direction. Her children have helped her do this job. The area where her property is located is three kilometers away from home and she travels there by pick-up truck. Florinda gets up very early in the morning to do housework and then goes to her nurseries on the coffee plantation with one of the children that lives with her to perform necessary upkeep, and then returns around noon. Florinda is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, manure, and to pay for skilled labor to help on the property with the nursery. With this she hopes to receive more income for her family, without losing faith in selling her harvest at a good price so that she can be successful and make a very good profit.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, and pay for labor to help with the coffee crop.

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka is married with four children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and is studying at university. Anther child is 20 years old and is studying at the first course of college, and another is going to eleventh class. Her little daughter is going to ninth class.

Maleyka has been in the tailoring business for long years. She sews skirts, blouses, and other women’s dress, and she also sews curtains. She periodically receives orders from her customers and prepares orders.

Today she is planning to increase her working capital to buy new material. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She says she is thankful to the Kiva organization for a loan.

In the future, she wants to open a curtain store and help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy new material so she can increase business and, in the future, help her children in their education and open a curtain store.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en:
Muzafar is one of the hardworking and responsible residents of the city of Kulyab . He is 56 years old, and in his city he is a respected man.  He always helps people in need. 

Muzafar has 2 sons. They are married and very well-educated.   The older son is engaged in agriculture, the youngest sells meat in the market. 

For 5 years, Muzafar has been engaged in agriculture, but in his free time he works as taxi driver.  In order to have a good life, he works day and night. 

Soon the irrigation season will open in Tajikistan, and to make his work easier Muzafar wants to buy a modern tractor. As the tractor is expensive, he needs to take a loan. With this loan he will be able to increase his business and develop the city's agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Sitorabonu

texts.en:
This is Sitorabonu who lives in Gissar district. She is 32 years old. For 5 years she has been engaged in sewing. She sews different nationality's dresses and sells them. She likes her work and always is trying to improve it. She learned this activity with the help of her mother.  

Sitorabonu wants to improve her business. She is going to sew dresses for brides and sell them. Spring is approaching, the season of weddings and holidays in our country opens. For this reason she wants to buy beautiful fabrics and sew. 

She has many custumers and with their orders she will increase her business.  But currently she does not have enough money and she is asking Kiva lenders to support her. This loan is very important for Sitorabon. Just due to your help, she will be able to implement her plans.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 53-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. Leonora has been running a small sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her area for more than two years now.

Leonora would like to take a loan to buy more inventory to sell like: canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries and other items. A loan will help Leonora to improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Leonora’s future plans include the expansion of her business, so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell like: canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries, and other items

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre  membres du groupe Balimaya  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Banconi un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Assétou assise en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce des condiments à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  10 sacs d’oignons, 5 panier de tomates. Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché de Sikasso et les villages environnants. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au niveau du marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Balimaya’s four members are married women. They are on average thirty years old with three children. Most live in traditional families in Banconi, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, in Mali’s third administrative region. They are taking out this first loan from micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Mrs. Assétou, sitting in second position from left to right in the photo, is the one in the group to retail condiments. With her loan, she plans to purchase ten bags of onions and five baskets of tomatoes. She procures her supplies from the great market in Sikasso and from neighboring villages. In demand from a mostly female clientele thanks to the quality of her products, she retails for cash or on credit, from home or at the market.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF, part of which will be used to pay back the loan and its interests, and part of which will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Banconi un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame KADIATOU assise en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce des condiments à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  10 sacs d’oignons, 5 paniers de tomates, 1 sac de piment. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso et les villages environnants. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au niveau du marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi’s four members are married women. They are on average thirty-two years old with three children. Most live in traditional families in Banconi, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, in Mali’s third administrative region. They are taking out this first loan from micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Mrs. Kadiatou, sitting in second position from left to right in the photo, is the one in the group to retail condiments. With her loan, she plans to purchase ten bags of onions, five baskets of tomatoes, and one bag of hot peppers. She procures her supplies from Sikasso and neighboring villages. In demand from a mostly female clientele thanks to the quality of her products, she retails for cash or on credit, from home or at the market.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF, part of which will be used to pay back the loan and its interests, and part of which will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 49-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. Rosalia has been running a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place for more than five years now.

Rosalia would like to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries, and other items. A loan will help Rosalia in improving her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

Rosalia dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries, and other items.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines.  She earns a living through her retail sales of frozen food like tocino (bacon), chorizo (sausage), canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, snack foods and others. 

Melona is asking to take a loan to buy stock like  tocino (bacon), chorizo (sausage), canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, snack foods and others. A loan will help her improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Melona hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy tocino (bacon), chorizo (sausage), canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, snack foods and others.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Alice started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Taito, a remote village in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit.

Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Alice believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cow because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Alice waits for your kindness. With your support of this loan, you will be supporting the entrepreneurial ideas of a Kenyan mother!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte.  She earns a living through a tricycle transport business with her husband. This has been their source of income for more than five years now. Mildred also raises pigs to earn an additional income. 

Mildred is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle like wheel tire, nuts and bolts, chains and additional piglets to raise. This loan will enable her to improve her income and yield. In the future, Mildred hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle like wheel tire, nuts and bolts, chains and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nicel

texts.en:
Nicel is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She used to operate a sari-sari or variety store but she had to stop after it was ruined by a super typhoon. As of now, she decided to start again with her business to earn an income. 

Nicel would like to avail herself of a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and others. A loan will help her improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Nicel hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and others.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 51-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. Perla has been running a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place for more than 20 years now. 

Perla would like to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries, and other items. 

A loan will help Perla in improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Perla dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries, and other items

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of a five year old daughter from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

She is engaged in the retail sale of rice. This has been the source of her income for the past 2 years now. 

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. 

In the future, Lourdes hopes of making her rice retail business more successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
41 years of age, Janet is a vibrant and hard-working woman who is always looking for ways to make progress.She is based in Koibatek, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is “Mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. 

Janet has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Selling eggs and milk has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. Janet passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every morning to milk her cow. While this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Janet is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Martín De Jesús

texts.es:
Martin de 57 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.


Martin se levanta a las 6:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante todo el día en construcción en los alrededores de su localidad o afuera, fue la necesidad que lo llevó a trabajar en esta actividad y le ha servido como medio para cubrir los gastos del hogar.  

 
	Él solicita este crédito para comprar un vehículo y poder movilizarse hacia su trabajo y en su tiempo libre realizar viajes para obtener un ingreso adicional.
.
Sus planes son incursionar en la siembra de maíz u otros granos básicos.
texts.en: Martin is 57 years old and married, and his wife dedicates herself to domestic work. Martin gets up at 6:30 a.m. to go spend the entire day working in construction in the areas around where he lives. He started working in this business due to need and it has served as a means for covering his household expenses. He is asking for the loan to buy a vehicle to be able to go to work and to transport people in his free time to earn extra money. He plans to get involved in planting corn and other basic grains.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to be able to go to work and to transport people in his free time to earn extra money

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
La venta de suvenir es un negocio que ha pasado de generación en generación por la familia Escobar, una familia que no olvida sus raíces campesinas y que tratan de trasmitir sus folclor  y su pasión a través de sus productos.
Hoy el turno es para miguel un hombre de 46 años de edad, padre de 2 hijos, amable, gracioso y amoroso, vive junto con su pareja y su negocio representa el 100% de los ingresos de su hogar.
Con la ayuda de un crédito Miguel busca sostenibilidad de su negocio, seguir manteniendo las buenas relaciones con los clientes y aspira en un futuro poder dejarle el legado a sus hijos. 
Con el crédito comprara sandalias tradicionales, sombreros, ponchos, carrieles, alpargatas etc.
texts.en: Selling souvenirs is a business that has spanned generations in the Escobar family, a family that hasn't forgotten its rural roots and tries to express its customs and passion through its products. Now it's Miguel's turn, a friendly, funny, and caring 46 year old father of two children. He lives with his spouse and his business represents 100% of his household income. With the help of a loan Miguel will seek to make his business sustainable, continue maintaining a good relationship with his customers, and aspire to pass on the legacy to his children. With a loan he'll purchase traditional sandals, hats, ponchos, leather cases, canvas sandals, etc.

loans.use: To purchase traditional sandals, hats, ponchos, leather case, and canvas sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase manure, irrigation, and seeds to sustain his crops.

loans.name: Jenipha's Group

texts.en:
Jenipha, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 2 children.

With a portion of this loan, Jenipha will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Jenipha plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Jenipha’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Khoeu's Group

texts.en:
Khoeu’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khoeu makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as laborer to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Khoeu will use her part of her group loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help all of the group members be able to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles is 59 years old and is often referred to as a really experienced farmer. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Kakamega North District, formed by 10 farmers, including himself.

Charles has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2011, because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Charles’s Group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mercy, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 2 children, and is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Mercy joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Mercy plans to invest in a business.

Between the 8 farmers in Mercy's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo esta jubilado, tiene dos hijos que aún viven en casa, uno trabaja y el otro estudia.

Sandra, tiene una tienda, desde hace más de 15 años y fue su mamá quien la impulso para que la colocara, para buscar un ingreso extra.- Tambien tiene un molino de nixtamal y se dedica a hacer pupusas los fines de semana. 

Antes, solo se dedicaba a los oficios domesticos, los negocios los tiene en su casa. 

Sandra, necesita el crédito para surtir más su tienda con variedad de productos de la canasta básica, esto mejorara la condicion de su negocio, ya que podra ofrecer diferentes productos a sus clientes.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que pueda, para poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y pagar bien el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 46 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She's married a man who is retired, and the couple has two sons who still live at home. One of the children works, and the other attends school. 

Sandra has for more than 15 years run a grocery store in her home. She opened the business at the urging of her mother. Sandra was caring for her children and managing the household at the time, and her mother encouraged her to look for a new source of income. She also has a corn mill that she uses to prepare tortillas so she can sell pupusas (stuffed tortillas) on weekends. Before she went into business for herself, Sandra managed her family's household. 

Sandra is applying for a loan to stock her to purchase a variety of basic grocery items to stock her store. This investment will improve the condition of her store as she'll be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. 

Sandra hopes to keep running the store as well as she can so that she can repay the loan and provide her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of basic grocery items to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 57 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rosemary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rosemary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rosemary's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  cinq  membres du groupe Jiguisseme  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Kaboïla une des communes rurales  de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs trente septième prêts solidaires avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame ABI  débout en deuxième  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce de céréale  à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 sacs de 100 kg de mil, et 10 sac de 100 kg de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché . Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au niveau du marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Jiguisseme’s five members are married women. They are on average thirty-eight years old with four children. Most live in traditional families in Kaboïla, one of the rural townships in Sikasso, Mali’s third administrative region. They are taking out their thirty-seventh loan from micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Mrs. Abi, standing in second position from left to right in the photo, is the one in the group to retail cereals. With her loan, she plans to purchase five 100-kilo bags of millet and ten 100-kilo bags of corn. She procures her supplies from the great market. In demand from a mostly female clientele thanks to the quality of her products, she retails for cash or on credit, from home or at the market.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 50,000 XOF, part of which will be used to pay back the loan and its interests, and part of which will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les  cinq  membres du groupe Kossomine  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Kaboïla un des communes rurales  de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur treizième  prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Adiaratou débout en cinquième  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce des pagnes wax à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  20 complet de pagne wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au niveau du marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Kossomine’s five members are married women. They are on average thirty-six years old with four children. Most live in traditional families in Kaboïla, one of the rural townships in Sikasso, Mali’s third administrative region. They are taking out their thirteenth loan from micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Mrs. Adiaratou, standing in fifth position from left to right in the photo, is the one in the group to retail coupons of Wax fabric (a local printed cloth). With her loan, she plans to purchase twenty sets of wax fabric. She procures her supplies from Sikasso. In demand from a mostly female clientele thanks to the quality of her products, she retails for cash or on credit, from home or at the market.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 25,000 XOF, part of which will be used to repay the loan with interests, and part of which will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Tavus

texts.en:
Tavus is a welcoming and pleasant woman. She is 47 years old. She has been engaged in a livestock business for 6 years. She lives with family in Shahrituz district. Her children are studying and also help her with this work. 

Tavus adores her activity and looking after her animals. She has a barn and other conditions for the animals. She provides fresh milk to her family and relations. 

Today she decided to increase her income. For this reason, she wants to purchase several cattle. She believes with help of Kiva lenders she will be able to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase livestorck
