loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les   dix membres du groupe DANAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA un des quartier populaire la ville  de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs quatorzièmes prêts solidaires avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Fatoumata  débout en sixième  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce de savon à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  20 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au niveau du marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Danaya’s ten members are married women. They are on average thirty-eight years old with four children. Most live in traditional families in Ouayerma, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, in Mali’s third administrative region. They are taking out this fourteenth loan from micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Mrs. Fatoumata, standing in sixth position from left to right in the photo, is the one in the group to retail soap. With her loan, she plans to purchase twenty boxes of soap. She procures her supplies from the great market. In demand from a mostly female clientele thanks to the quality of her products, she retails for cash or on credit, from home or at the market.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 40,000 XOF, part of which will be used to pay back the loan and its interests, and part of which will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Trinidad earns an income through her sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her area. 

Trinidad is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack foods, condiments, and other items. 

This loan will enable her to attract more buyers to her store, thus allowing her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack foods, condiments, and other items

loans.name: Rozini

texts.en:
Rozini is a 54-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. Rozini has been running a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area for more than three years now. 

Rozini would like to take a loan to buy more inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries and other items. A loan will help Rozini in improving her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Rozini hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like: canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, snack foods, eggs, soap and toiletries, and other items

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small retail store business locally known as a sari-sari store. Lorenza has been in the business for more than four years now. 

Lorenza is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as rice, noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods and other items. Her loan will enable her to improve her inventories and attract more buyers to her store.  In the future, Lorenzo hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 56 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Lina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, chips, etc.

Lina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Luz es una responsable y trabajadora madre, campesina por nacimiento orgullosa de su tierra y de su familia, junto con su esposo constituyen una muy unida familia en la cual sus 5 hijos conforman un pilar de armonía que han formado y tratan de mantenerlo cada día.
Para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Luz inicio su negocio su negocio de producción agrícola, el cual ha ido trabajando y tratando de hacer crecerlo para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos y pagos de Jornales pues hay unas actividades muy pesadas que no puede realizar.
Tu ayuda puede ser muy significativa para la gente del campo que trabajan hasta 12 horas diarias para conseguir los recursos que se consumen en un hogar.
texts.en: Luz is a responsible and hardworking mother. She was born in the countryside and is proud of her land and her family. She and her husband form a very united family in which their five children are a pillar of harmony that they have made and try to maintain each day. To help her husband with the household expenses, Luz started her agricultural production business, which she has been trying to grow in order to improve her family's living conditions. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for irrigation and labor, as these are very heavy activities she cannot do. Your help can be very significant for the people in the countryside who work up to 12 hours a day to obtain the resources consumed in a home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for irrigation and labor

loans.name: Norma Del Rosario

texts.es:
Norma es una creativa, curiosa, muy trabajadora y emprendedora mujer madre de 3 hijos que gracias A dios se han formado bien bajo su amoroso manto.
Se gana su vida de la producción agrícola que la hace a pequeña escala y con una tienda de abarrotes que tiene ubicada en el sector y la cual es de gran ayuda para vereda debido a la lejanía que esta tiene con la cabecera municipal.
Norma busca un apoyo, que personas confíen en ella y le presten dinero con la intención de dirigirse a la plaza y abastecer su negocio, esto lo debe hacer cada periodo de tiempo ya que el transporte de la mercancía siempre es costoso.
Con la ayuda de un crédito comprara granos como arroz, frijol, algunas verduras y frutas que no se  cultivan en la vereda, productos de aseo personal que son muy importantes, productos congelados entre otros.
texts.en: Norma is a creative, curious, very hard-working and enterprising woman who's the mother of 3 children that thankfully have grown up well under her loving protection. She makes a living in agricultural production that she carries out on a small scale and with a grocery store that she set up in the area and which has been a big help to the orchard because of the latter's distance from the municipal capital. Norma is looking for some assistance, for people to have faith in her and lend her some money so that she can go to the marketplace and stock her business. She has to do this periodically because transporting merchandise is always expensive. With the help of a loan she'll purchase staple foods like rice, beans, some vegetables and fruits not grown in the orchard, some personal hygiene products that are very important, and frozen products among other things.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of staple foods such as rice, beans, some vegetables and fruits that aren't grown in the orchard, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 48 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mely has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for more than twenty years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Grace is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Grace started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Grace’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Wilmar Jose

texts.es:
Wilmar, de 27 años de edad, es bachiller, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con el papá y una hermana, pero comparten los gastos y no depende de el. 

Wilmar, trabaja con ganado de repasto y de doble propósito, lo ha hecho por más de diez años y lo aprendió de su padre; decidió hacerlo cuando falleció su mamá y su padre tambien enfermó y el tuvo que hacerse responsable de todos los gastos de la casa. 

Tambien, trabaja la agricultura y hace viajes en su pick up.- La distancia que camina para llegar donde tiene sus cultivos y sus animales es de 1 km desde su casa y su horario es variado. 

Wilmar, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado bovino de repasto, le mejorara mucho su negocio, ya que podra tener más ganado para repastar y esto le permitirá tener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El, se sentira satisfecho al cubrir esa necesidad y utilizara el alimento que tiene para el ganado. 

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando, ya que desea retomar sus estudios universitarios y cree que el préstamo le ayudara mucho, para lograr realizar sus sueños.
texts.en: 27-year-old Wilmar, who completed his secondary education, is single, has no children and lives with his father and a sister. They do, however, share the expenses and do not rely solely on him. Wilmar works with dual purpose grazing cattle and has been doing this for over ten years, having learned his trade from his father. He decided to take up this kind of work when his mother died and, with his father also ill, he had to be responsible for all the household expenses. He also works in agriculture and travels in his pick-up truck. He lives 1 kilometre from the place where he has his crops and animals and he has a varied timetable. He needs the loan to buy grazing cattle  to improve his business. Having more grazing cattle will enable him to boost his income and improve his quality of life. He will be happy to be able to cover this need and he will use the food that he has for the cattle. His dreams are to carry on working, as he would like to resume his university studies. He believes that the loan will be a huge help to him when it comes to achieving his ambitions.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Los contractos con constructoras son un punto a favor y en contra para las personas del campo, en ocasiones estos destruyen zonas verdes, pero para otros es una gran posibilidad de emplearse, ya que algunos son conscientes de las personas del pueblo y los contratan para realizar trabajos.
Una de las personas beneficiadas es la señora Elizabeth que con el contrato que obtuvo por una empresa confeccionara sus uniformes, una gran oportunidad de progreso y de mostrar sus dotes como confeccionista.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de telas y accesorios para confeccionar las prendas y tu apoyo puede significar el progreso de una familia que la conforma ella, su pareja y dos hijos menores de edad que aspiran a poder regresar a clases.
texts.en:
Doing business with builders has a downside - some development wipes out green spaces - but construction activity can also create job opportunities.   Some construction companies care about people in their communities and hire local residents to do work. 

Elizabeth is one small businesswoman who has benefited from such an arrangement. She made a contract to provide uniforms, which represents a great opportunity to both earn income and demonstrate her skill as a seamstress.  

Elizabeth is applying for a loan for the purchase of fabric and supplies for making clothes. Elizabeth is a wife and the mother of two young sons, so your  support can improve her life and her family's. Her children currently don't attend school, but hope to return to their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making uniforms.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un veterano campesino que durante su crecimiento y maduración mostro grandes dotes de líder e independencia, trazo su propio camino al montar un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, guiado por su instinto y un poco de necesidad.
Entre sus metas están el mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su utilidad y hacer una relación más cercana con todos sus clientes y poco a poco va encaminando estos sueños.
Él solicita un crédito para la compra de un enfriador y surtido en víveres como frijoles, latas de comida, surtido de panadería, especias, etc. 
Tu apoyo será muy importante pues las personas de veredas tan apartadas tiene un apoyo muy limitado.
texts.en: Carlos is a veteran farmer who throughout his growth and maturation displayed great leadership and independence. He forged his own path by establishing a grocery store business, guided by his instinct and a bit of need. His goals include boosting his sales, raising his revenues, and building a closer relationship with all of his customers and bit by bit he's moving these dreams forward. He's requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator and an assortment of supplies such as beans, canned food, an assortment of baked goods, spices, etc. Your help will be very important because people from such remote villages have very limited support.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler, an assortment of supplies, and refrigerated products.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Mary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Mary's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Fronah's Group

texts.en:
Fronah, pictured above, has 7 children and is described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader for her group. Fronah is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Fronah has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Fronah is planning to buy a goat.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Fronah's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Grace, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Grace is known by her community as a very reliable person, and decided to represent her group because wanted to help more farmers.

Initially, Grace joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Grace plans to invest in a business.

Between the 12 farmers in Grace's Group, a total of 7.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is married and has two adult sons. Rosario owns her house. Rosario is still making cakes and pastries and her husband is still helping her. Rosario is 48 years old and she learned how to make cakes and pastries when she was very young. She works from 5:00 am and she makes 24 cakes every day. Rosario needs a loan because she needs to buy flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients. If you help her you will help Rosario to save money and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients to make her cakes.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 29 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sharon has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Litein area of Kenya. Annah is a lovely mother who has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, maize and milk, and also has a personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. 

Annah, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Annah is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a Kiva field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

Annah’s biggest dream is to get ahead in her business and offer her children a better quality of life and more financial stability. She knows that through Kiva lenders help, she will be able to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a dairy farmer based in the Kaptumo village, in the Nandihills area of Kenya, an area that lends well to dairy farming. Celestine has been involved in dairy farming for 6 good years and this allows her to take care of her 2 children. Her primary income is from milk, but she also makes money selling eggs. She stated that dairy farming is very practical and enjoyable. However, the challenge is labor and transportation costs. 
Celestine is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle. Locally, the courier bikes are well-known as 'Boda boda'. They are used to transport goods and passengers within short distances, especially in areas inaccessible by cars. With your lending, Celestine will secure a Boda boda that will make the transportation of milk and other goods to the market easier, more convenient, faster and cheaper. It is a much improved mode of transportation compared to the wheelbarrows that she is currently using. 
The money she will make and save from this investment will go toward her children's education. Her family will feel the direct impact of this investment with better food and an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike (Boda boda)

loans.name: Banco Mujer Monte Sión Group

texts.es:
Marleny es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Monte Sión, su grupo lo integran 6 socias más que de dedican a las actividades agropecuarias todas. 
La señora Marleny tiene 54 años se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias, junto a su esposo. Ambos en una pequeña parcela que fue otorgada por una institución del Bien Social, desarrollan sus actividades de agricultura, cría y desarrollo de pollos y cerdos;  El cuál es la única fuente de ingresos económicos para esta familia. 
Este es el segundo crédito que solicita la señora, y el primer financiamiento fue de gran ayuda ya que les permitió contar con más insumos para mejorar y aumentar la producción y sus cosechas. Este nuevo crédito será invertido en la compra de pollos, alimentos, concentrados y otros, ya que es la aérea de avicultura la que necesitan reforzar. 
Doña Marleny está trabajando en un fondo de ahorro que les permita tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marleny is one of the members of the Monte Sión Women's Bank. Her group has six other members who all make a living from agricultural activities.

Marleny is 54 years old and makes a living from agricultural activities along with her husband. They farm and raise chickens and pigs on a small plot of land granted by a social well-being institution. This is the family's only source of income.

This is the second loan that she has requested; the first loan was a great help as it allowed her to have more supplies to improve and increase her production and her crops. This new loan will be invested in buying chickens, food, concentrates and other items, as she needs to strengthen her poultry business. 

Marleny is working in a savings fund that will allow her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, food, concentrates and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock like sugar, soda and cooking oil  to sell.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
María Edelmira es una veterana vendedora de mercancía, desde el año 1999 trabaja como independiente pues se cansó de recibir órdenes y aparte de que tenía trabajos muy pesados ganaba un muy bajo capital.
Su perseverancia y su buena actitud la llevaron asacar a delante un negocio de venta de lociones, desodorantes, vajillas, ollas y es este negocio el que le ha permitido mantener a sus 6 hijos. 
María Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en grandes cantidades, el monto lo justifica en que distribuirá pedidos a otros pueblos y veredas.
texts.en: María Edelmira is an experienced saleswoman. She has been self-employed since 1999 because she became tired of receiving orders and not only did she have very difficult tasks to do but she also earned very little. Her perseverance and good attitude led her to set up a business selling lotions, deodorant, crockery and pots and this has enabled her to support her 6 children. María is applying for a loan to buy large quantities of stock which she needs because she will be delivering orders to other towns and roadsides.

loans.use: to buy lotions, pots and deodorants to sell in towns and by the roadside

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es:
Como sonreír, como no estallar de alegría y emoción, Abel se siente muy contento motivado, un poco preocupado y es que gracias a la corporación Interactuar y al convenio Kiva, puede tener la posibilidad de iniciar su propio negocio de piscicultura, un sueño que ha perseguido muchos años pero por diferentes circunstancia básicamente económicas no ha podido lograrlo.
Con tu ayuda este hombre tendrá un negocio para generar el sustento de su pareja y sus 4 hijos, ayúdalo, un pequeño apoyo mantendrá ferviente esa sonrisa.
Con el crédito solicitado Abel adecuara el estanque, comprar alimento y peces.
texts.en:
Smiling, and bursting from happiness and excitement, Abel feels very content and motivated. He is a little preoccupied, because thanks to the Corporación Interactuar and the Kiva agreement, he can have the possibility of starting his own aquaculture business. This is a dream he has chased for many years, but because of different basic financial circumstances, he hasn't been able to achieve it.

With your help, this man will have a business to generate support for his spouse and their 4 children. Help him. With a little support, he will keep his fervent smile.

With the loan he has asked for, Abel will set up the tank and buy feed and fish.

loans.use: to start his aquaculture business, investing in fish, set-up and in feed.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo que se dedica a  trabajar al jornal de trabajos de agricultura y  sus 2 hijas de 11 y 12 años y asisten a la escuela, Lidia lleva 10 años dedicada a la crianza de animales menores,  el crédito lo necesita para comprar chanchos que los alado de la casa que le presta un primo para que viva, la aspiración de Lidia es que mejore su negocio y que sus hijos salgan adelante por medio de sus estudios.
texts.en: Lidia is 28 years old, she lives with her husband, who works as an agricultural day labourer, and their two daughters of 11 and 12 years old who attend school. Lidia has worked in small animal husbandry for 10 years. She needs the loan to buy pigs which she cares for next to the house that her cousin has lent her to live in. Lidia's aspiration is to improve her business and that her children get ahead in life by way of their studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough fire extinguisher inventory to meet demand.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una habilidosa, creativa, sonriente y responsable confeccionista que con su creatividad e investigación crea novedosas prendas para sus clientes.
Hace un poco más de un año inicio su negocio y en el momento está en consolidación pero va por buen camino dado que sus diseños tan diferentes y salidos de lo común impactan a los clientes.
Con la ayuda de un crédito Nelly quiere comprar telas e insumos como nylon, broches y otros accesorios para crear sus prendas.
Un aporte podría hacer el cambio, sería darles la oportunidad a personas como Nelly de generar su propio sustento y mantener a su familia. 
No le cortes las alas, permite que vuele hacia un mejor futuro y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly is a capable, creative, joyful and responsible seamstress who using her creativity and by trying out creates innovative garments for her customers.
A little over a year ago she started her business and at the moment, although it is still consolidating itself, it is progressing well as her innovative designs are so different and out of the ordinary that they have a positive impact with the customers.

With the help of a loan Nelly wants to buy cloth and other necessities such as nylon, pins and other accessories to create her garments.
The contribution could make the change and it would be giving people like Nelly the opportunity to generate their own income and support her family.
Don't clip her wings, allow her to fly towards a better future and a better better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other necessities, such as nylon, pins and other accessories to create her garments.

loans.name: Absalom's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Absalom, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to 2 children, and is known in his community as a very hard-working individual.

Initially, Absalom joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because he wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has learned a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Absalom plans to save more money for the future.

Between the 12 farmers in Absalom's Group, a total of 7 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Rudina

texts.en:
This is Rudina, photographed with the two milk cows she currently has.  She wants to buy a mule to use it for transportation of her homemade goods to the farmer’s market. Your loan will help her do just that and she will be very appreciative of your help.

Rudina is 43 years old and a married mother of three, ages 23, 20 and 18 years old.  She has been working with livestock for about ten years now. With the raw milk from the two cows, she makes cheese and sells it to the market of another city, Elbasan, and also at the farmer’s market in the city of Korca, the closest to her village. 

She sells roughly 100 kg of cheese/month at a price of $5/kg. The two oldest sons help with the livestock as well, since they live in the village near their parents.

loans.use: to buy a mule to transport the dairy products she makes to the farmer's market, which is a long distance from the village

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is an energetic young man aged 35 who has 2 children. He is hard working and resilient. All his children are in school and depending on him for survival.  

Because of such family responsibilities, he resorted to serious banana farming.  He produced many bunches of matooke in a month, supplying nearby schools and the neighbouring town.  This activity has enabled him to pay his children's school fees and generally look after the whole family. 

Through his farming income,  he has also managed to start up an alternative business of a drug shop.  There was so much demand yet the services were not there. He therefore requests a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to boost his drug shop. He will buy stock of daily medications such as acetaminophen, cold caps, flu meds, malaria drugs and others, which are requested by many residents.

loans.use: to buy tablets to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is in the car body repair business and he has his own workshop. Cesar is 34 years old and he lives in his parents-in-law's house. Cesar is married and his wife sells bed covers. Cesar has a son. Cesar needs a loan to buy more tools that will give him the chance to attend more customers. Cesar wants to have a bigger workshop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more tools.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is 39 years old. She is divorced and has 2 sons. She lives at her mother's house. Estela works at an ice cream shop as a waitress. Now she is living with her mother and needs a loan to fix one of the rooms she occupies. The family had some troubles because of the rains so she needs to fix the walls of the room. Right now Estela is the only person in the house that is working so she needs your help and she thanks you for the support you gave her for her last loan.

loans.use: to fix the walls of a room that was damaged during the rains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Six years ago, Dorice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kona mbaya, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kitale area. Dorice has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Dorice can achieve their dreams and goals. Dorice believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling shoes at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation. With the loan of 20,000 she is requesting, Belinda wants to purchase a stock of pairs of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Harun's Group

texts.en:
Harun is 53 years old and has 5 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Harun is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Harun started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Harun’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of clothes and bedding.

loans.name: Dorine's Group

texts.en:
Dorine is 52 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Dorine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Dorine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Dorine's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Josephine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Josephine plans to use the profits she gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Josephine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Kisa Kyamukama Kosovo Salaama Group

texts.en:
Aisha, a new member of the group, was inspired by the other members' progress in joining Ugafode and decided to be a part of the group. She is a married woman with a children and is applying for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to add stock in her business. She hopes this will help to expand her business. 

Aisha thanks the group for accepting her and Kiva for partnering with her. She is hardworking and diligent. The sixth person is the credit officer in charge of the group at the extreme right.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business

loans.name: Emisael Jose

texts.es:
Emisael es un hombre de 60 años de edad, un trabajador muy honrado y humilde que goza y disfruta de su trabajo, de ebanistería pues este represento por muchos años el sustento de su familia conformada por su pareja y sus 5 hijos.
Sus habilidades para la construcción y reparación de muebles las adquirió trabajando en una empresa la cual dejo años después para emprender su propio camino.
Una de las dificultades de Emisael es la falta de capital para comprar materiales y herramientas y es este inconveniente el que lo tiene en una difícil situación de la cual solo su apoyo lo pueden salvar.
Con ayuda de un crédito Emisael quiere comprar insumos para la construcción de puertas y comprar una maquina pulidora que serán un gran impulso para su negocio.
texts.en:
Emisael, a 60 year old man, is an honest and modest worker who enjoys his work as a carpenter.  For many years, this job has provided sustenance for his family, which includes his partner and five children.

He acquired his skills in building and repairing furniture working in a business that he left years later in order to go his own way.

One of Emisael’s difficulties is the lack of capital to purchase materials and tools, and this is a problem that has him in a difficult situation where only your support can save him.

With the help of a loan, Emisael wishes to purchase materials for building doors and purchase a polishing machine, which will be a big boost for his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building doors and purchase a polishing machine, which will be a big boost for his business.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is seeking your financial help to repair the roofing of her family house. Kindly note that she lives in the coldest region of Albania with lots of snow and rain. Due to the climate factors, house roofs destroy easily and fast as well. With about 10 percent of the loan, she will buy a cheap couch type of thing.

Natasha does agriculture/livestock, and she does not sell any of her products, whether dairy or fresh produce. All in all, she owns about 18 dynyms of agricultural land where she plants wheat in 8 dynym and gives the wheat to the bread factory in return for the bread she needs for the year. In 7 dynym, she plants rye, and in the other two, she plants beets. Both of these go for food for her animals that she has, in total 10 goats and six sheep. The cheese she makes from the animals is for family use. 

In addition to this, she makes about $200/month retirement pension. Her husband receives a pension as well of about $144/month in addition to other pay as a night man in a nearby scrap-collecting yard.

loans.use: to repair the roofing of her family house, as they live in the coldest region of the country where the snow and the cold damages the roofs of villagers very often

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a repeat borrower, having borrowed ten times from UGAFODE Microfinance. She is a businesswoman in Bushenyi town, running a mini supermarket. She started this business in the year 1986 with a hope of getting enough money which would help her to develop herself and the entire family. She is a hardworking woman, who works 12 hours per day, and is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school. 

Mary would like to use the four million five hundred thousand shillings loan to restock the supermarket so that she can satisfy her customers with good and better quality goods in the desired quantities. Her customers are mainly people from around Bushenyi and the nearby places who have helped her greatly in growing her business. Mary hopes to buy a car, pay all the school dues for her children, and develop her family using the profits from the business in her operations. 

Mary is challenged by the people who never pay their debts after she has given them goods on credit since this causes her losses sometimes. The goods sometimes expire before they are bought and this is also a challenge to her since this also causes her losses. However, despite the challenges she is hopeful that the business will further grow and it will bring her enough money as profits which she will use to develop her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in the supermarket.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: Maria con el crédito solicitado compro los insumos agrícolas para asistir una manzana de café utilizando abono 18-46-0, fertilizantes, foliares, cal y pago mano de obra con la que pudo dar a sus cultivos una mejor atención y a los insumos un mejor aprovechamiento. Gracias a este crédito su propiedad y negocio fue más próspero obteniendo mejores ganancias sobre el mismo y esto permitió la cancelación del préstamo agradeciendo de esta manera el apoyo brindado. Maria Manifiesta que sin el apoyo brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL sus esperanzas de crecimiento en su negocio estaban perdidas ya que no quería pedir prestado a los prestamistas de la comunidad quienes comprometen la cosecha y las tasas de interés elevadas trabajando prácticamente para ellos. Maria solicita se le apoye en esta segunda ocasión con un nuevo crédito con el cual asistirá nuevamente sus cultivos de café esperando tener mejores ganancias y resultados que la temporada anterior para dar a su familia una mejor vida y mejor futuro.
texts.en: María used her first loan to buy agricultural supplies to be used for tending her coffee plantation with manure 18-46-0, fertiliser, foliar applications, lime and to pay workers. All of this meant that she could look after her crops better and make better use of the supplies. Thanks to the loan, her plot and business prospered and she was able to boost her income. As a result, she paid off the loan and expressed her thanks for the help she received. María says that without the help from the COMIXMUL cooperative her hopes of expanding her business would have been lost because she did not want to  borrow from local moneylenders who would compromise the harvest and, with their high interest rates, she would be practically working for them. Now, for a second time, María is applying for a loan to help her tend her coffee crops. She hopes that this will enable her to boost her income and achieve a better yield than last year so that she can provide a better life and future for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser and foliar applications and to pay workers to help her tend her coffee crop

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en: Graciela is 41 years old and describes herself as a happy person that enjoys working and playing volleyball. She started her stationery store 14 years ago, she sells office supplies and does photocopying. She is asking for a loan to restock her store because she sees sales improving. Her goal is to provide the best product variety in her neighborhood so clients don't need to look in any other store.

loans.use: to buy products to restock her stationery store.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Her husband also assists her in selling milk door-to-door. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a school for the last 14 years. Today, there are over 100 boys and girls in her school. 

She requires a loan of 75,000 PKR to buy chairs and desks for her students. A firm believer in working hard to achieve your goals, Shahnaz wants to offer her students the chance for success.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her students.

loans.name: Karen Michel

texts.en: Karen Michel is 21 years old and lives with her husband in their in-law's house. She bakes and sells pastries and her husband drives a taxi. Karen Michel is asking for a loan to buy products in bulk to increase her production volume and increase her profit margins. She says that, with her work and the support of her husband's parents, she and her husband have been able to achieve some financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk for her bakery business.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en: Erik is 32 years old and he is living with his mother. Erik is the father of an 8 year old daughter. He works as a taxi driver but he is going to college to be a journalist. Erik works in the city of La Paz and he needs a loan to change the engine of his car. Erik is very responsible and he will thank you a lot if you support him because he is the only one in his home that works.

loans.use: change the engine of his car

loans.name: Flor De Alejandria Group

texts.en:
Five minutes off the highway that connects the two largest cities of Guatemala, the capital and Quetzaltenango, is the small village of Nueva (New) Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. The village was built following massive landslides that destroyed over half of the village of Antigua (Old) Santa Catariana Ixtahuacan, during the rains of Hurricane Mitch in 1998. Searching for higher ground the founders of Nueva Santa Catarina built the city at an elevation of 10,000 feet above sea level.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Alejandria” (Alexandria’s Flower), is made up of seven women who live and work in Nueva Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. The women mostly work with traditional textiles of the region, weaving and designing traditional Maya dresses, blouses and fabrics. One of Flor de Alejandria's seven members is Ana, a 42-year-old mother of three. Ana’s primary business is buying traditional dresses and blouses called “huipiles” from vendors in the surrounding communities, and then selling them for a profit. Currently, Ana travels every week to the pacific coast to sell the hand crafted textiles to clients in regions where the production of textiles is not as common. Ana plans to use this loan to purchase new huipiles and dresses to increase her inventory and stay current with the newest styles and designs. With this loan Ana will have access to higher quality textiles and a higher return on her investment. Ana is determined to create a more profitable business in order to continue supporting her three children with their education, and guaranteeing that they all graduate with a degree. With the support of KIVA investors, Ana will have the opportunity to build a brighter future for her children and herself. 
Thank you, KIVA investors, for supporting the entrepreneurial visions of Ana and her fellow Friendship Bridge Trust Bank members! With your loans, Ana will have the opportunity to realize the vision she has for her children with the income from her small business.

loans.use: To purchase new huipiles and dresses to increase inventory and stay current with the newest styles and designs

loans.name: Catalinas Ixtahuacan Group

texts.en:
Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan is a small village in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, five minutes off one of the country’s major highways that connects the two most populated cities, Quetzaltenango and Guatemala City. Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, sitting at an altitude of 10,000 feet, experiences dramatic changes in weather, often dipping below freezing, leading locals to call it “Alaska.” The Friendship Trust Bank “Catalinas Ixtahuacan,” is made up of seven entrepreneurial women from “Alaska,” who are applying for their second loan funded by KIVA investors. 

Magdalena, a new member of the Trust Bank, is determined to expand her business with the support of a small loan. Magdalena is requesting a loan to purchase threads, dyes and materials to create the traditional textiles of the region. Although Magdalena is a new member of the Trust Bank, she has over 15 years of experience weaving traditional skirts and blouses, adapting every year to the newest trends in styles. Currently, Magdalena sells her hand crafted textile, twice a week on market days in the neighboring town of Nahuala. With this loan, Magdalena will be able to increase her inventory and create a more competitive business, in order to return from Nahuala on market days with more profit. As a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank member, Magdalena will receive monthly educational trainings on business administration, health and womens rights as part of FB’s Microcredit Plus program.  Magdalena is excited for her first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and the possibility to expand her business with the support of the Trust Bank. 
By investing in Magdalena and the other six women of “Catalinas Ixtahuacan,” KIVA investors are supporting the empowerment of women by providing the opportunity to expand and improve their businesses. “Catalinas Ixtahuacan,” with the support of this loan, will have the opportunity to determine their own futures and the futures of their families and communities. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your continued support!

loans.use: to purchase threads, dyes and materials to create the traditional textiles of the region.

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.en:
Santa Cruz el Quiche is the municipal capital of Quiche, the department in Guatemala with the highest incidence of poverty, with around 85 percent of the population considered poor-- 33 percent of which are extremely poor. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Sirenas” (Mermaids), is made up of seven motivated women of El Quiche. Candelaria, a 43-year-old member, joined the Trust Bank to expand her established business as the owner of a small restaurant.  Candelaria, on her fourth loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, is an incredible leader and organizer, guiding newer members through the process. With a smile Candelaria explained that she works every day of the week from five in the morning until midnight, preparing, cooking and serving Guatemalan snacks and refreshments. The everyday fare of her restaurant, named after her mother who originally opened the business, consists of tostadas, chuchitos (tamales made with corn), and Atole (a hot corn based drink). Candelaria is applying for this loan in order to buy another stove, utensils, pots and pans, so that she can serve her many customers quicker and more efficiently. Candelaria, with her current business running into capacity constraints, sees the opportunity to open another location. With the support of KIVA investors, Candelaria will be able to maximize her current space and build toward opening another location.

loans.use: to buy another stove, utensils, pots and pans, so that she can serve her many customers quicker and more efficiently

loans.name: Kulizar

texts.ru: Кулизар 47 лет, вдова, есть сын, ему 19 лет. У Кулизар средне-специальное образование. Она работает социальным работником, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она 13 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, сын активно и с удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Кулизар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коров, 11 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,20 ГА, где Кулизар выращивает люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS), этого не хватает на достойную жизнь Кулизар и ее сына, поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота, так как в этом году из-за засухи собственный урожай не выдался. Доходы от кредита Кулизар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и приобрести корм на всю зиму.
texts.en:
Kulizar is 47 and a widow with a 19-year-old son. She has a specialist high school education and is employed as a social worker. She also works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income, a business she began 13 years ago. Her son helps her actively and happily with the farm work. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has eight cows and 11 sheep on her farm as well as 1.2 hectares of land where she grows hay for her own use. 

Kulizar's monthly income is about 13,000 KGS, which isn't enough to cover the family's needs. Therefore, with the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 KGS to purchase livestock feed, since this year, due to a drought, her own crops failed. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and into acquiring feed for the whole winter.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed in order to invest in her business and improve her income

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда, 56 лет, не замужем, все дети взрослые. У Мавлюды высшее образование, она работает в детском саду завхозом и медсестрой. В  2012 году она стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Мавлюды на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мавлюда обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец. Доходы от ведения бизнеса позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи и развить ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Mavlyuda is 56 and unmarried with grown-up children. She has a higher education and works in a kindergarden as a nurse and assistant manager. In 2012 she started working in animal husbandry and agriculture with 20,000 KGS she had saved. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two cows and 30 sheep with a total monthly income of about 30,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Mavlyuda has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase 20 sheep. Profits from the loan will allow her to improve her family's living situation and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase her revenue

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a small dairy farmer who makes a living from selling his cows' milk and cultivating corn to produce their feed. He used to spend a significant amount of his revenue on buying LP gas and chemical fertilizers, which was inhibiting him from saving money to expand his farm. By investing in a bio-digester, he will be able to remove these expensive and fossil fuel-based costs, as he will produce his own bio-gas and bio-fertilizer from his cows' manure. His wife will no longer use wood to cook and inhale the toxic smoke, as the bio-digester will be directly connected to the cook stove and boiler in the house, leading to important health benefits for the whole family. In addition, Edgar is interested in applying the potent and nutrient-rich fertilizer on his corn field, in order to increase his crops' yield in a natural way, without using any chemicals. As he starts to generate savings, Edgar plans to buy more cows to increase milk production, leading to additional income with which he could buy a tractor and send his children to university.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the bio-digester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With her KES 50,000 loan Mwanasha wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан 44 года, вдова, мать 4 сыновей. У Гулжан - среднее образование. С 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, у нее развитое хозяйство. Ежемесячный доход от ведения бизнеса составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Сыновья помогают Гулжан материально, но этого не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для разведения. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и улучшение благосостояния ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulzhan is 44 and a widow with four sons. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1990. Her farm brings in about 5,000 KGS per month. Her sons help her financially, but not enough to cover her needs. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulzhan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase calves for breeding. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of domestic livestock and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves to increase her number of livestock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a mother of 2 boys aged 14 and 5. 

For the last 11 years, Joyce has been a trader of African arts and curios which she supplies to small-scale sellers located all across South Africa. 

Joyce is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy bulk stock directly from West Africa. She plans to buy wooden ebony crafts and masks sourced from the world famous Ashanti carvers of Ghana. Joyce also wants to move into her own store and employ someone to sell while she is out supplying as she currently has to close shop whenever she’s out of Johannesburg hence losing a substantial amount of business.

Eventually, Joyce hopes to control a large supply chain moving into the rest of Africa as well as Europe where demand is high.

loans.use: to buy wooden ebony crafts and masks sourced from the world famous Ashanti carvers of Ghana.

loans.name: Sohrab

texts.en: Sohrab is a 49-year-old man who is a driver. He is married with two children and lives in the Abseron region with his lovely family. Sohrab’s family have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Kalbajar city for over 22 years. His wife is a teacher at school. It was noted that Sohrab is a driver; he has been transporting building materials for many years. His truck was broken and he can’t work. For this reason he has applied to Komak company for a loan. With this loan he will repair his truck. He needs 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He hopes that his truck will be repaired soon and he will start to work again. Sohrab is thankful to the Kiva organization for help. In the future, Sohrab wants to help his children with their education.

loans.use: to repair his truck and increase his business. In the future he wants to help his children with their education.

loans.name: Gulbeste

texts.en: Gulbeste is living in the Absheron region with her lovely big family of her husband and four children. Her elder son is going to college. In the future he wants to be a programmer. Other children are going to school. The family members are refugees from Cabrail city, and for over 22 years they have been living like IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). Gulbeste has been in the poultry business for many years. She is raising chickens, and sells their eggs and meat. Today, to expand her poultry farm she needs a loan in the amount of 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Gulbeste is very grateful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future she wants to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm and increase business. In the future she wants to help her children with their education.

loans.name: Ajkay Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is famous for its market days on Thursday and Sunday, when thousands of people selling and buying produce, textiles, meat and spices, flood into the small city center. Most of the venders commute from surrounding rural communities to take advantage of the city’s famous market. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Ajkay,” is made up of twelve women from one of the neighboring rural communities. 

“Ajkay” is applying for their second loan funded by Kiva investors, after making their final payment on their previous loan at the end of January. The twelve women of the Trust Bank have all returned to continue working with Friendship Bridge to expand their businesses and improve their quality of life. Micaela, one of the younger members of “Ajkay” at 20 years old, is entering her third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Micaela is requesting a loan to buy chickens and pigs to continue expanding her business of animal husbandry. Micaela has always worked with animals, gaining knowledge and experience, working with the animals on her family’s property since she was very little. Micaela hopes that with the profit gained from her small animal husbandry business she can one day re-invest the money and open a small store. By investing in a small store, Micaela believes she will have a less volatile business. In order to one day open a small store, Micaela is determined to make the most of her existing business by increasing her inventory of animals. As part of a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, Micaela will also receive monthly trainings in savings, business administration, health and women’s rights from her loan officer, who is supporting her to achieve her ultimate goal. Kiva investors, by funding this loan, will help Micaela take the next step in her young business career. 

Thank you, Kiva investors, for continuing to support the women of “Ajkay” with affordable loans that improve their ability to create a sustainable and profitable business. We look forward to updating investors on Micaela’s and the rest of “Ajkay's" business successes.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs to continue expanding her business of animal husbandry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pasta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Davlatbi

texts.en:
Davlatbi is 53 years old. Davlatbi lives in Kulob city with her husband and sons. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is 59 years old. Her sons are 32 and 27 years old and they are earning in the Russian Federation. Davlatbi’s husband is master to repair cars. 
Three years ago, Davlatbi learned to cut and sew women's clothing. She likes her job. From his activity, she likes to sew a national women's clothing. She takes orders at home, and it is perfect for her. Your loan will help her to buy a modern sewing machine and improve her activities.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is married and lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. To earn a living, Rogelio and his wife manage a rice farm. He also engages in palay trading, a rice retailing business, and he owns a sari-sari store. He has mastered doing these types of activities for many years to support their needs. He joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in May of 2011. He is a hardworking father who has strong determination to pursue his goals for the benefit of his family. Rogelio requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase the crop yield on his rice farm. This will help give his farming income a big boost and provide his children with a good and decent life. Someday, he hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of his produce and variety rice.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase crop yield on his rice farm

loans.name: Rodilla

texts.en:
Rodilla thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could obtain financial assistance for her chosen business. Rodilla has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale, as well as bags of feed. Rodilla wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house and to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale, as well as bags of feed.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 47-year-old married woman who has been in the business of milk selling for many years. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to give her family a decent life. She is a mother of six children and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. Now she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase one more cow in order to boost her earnings. She hopes to increase her production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow in order to boost her earnings

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of cattle trade with the help of her husband from many years. She buys baby goats and calves, raises them, and then sells them in the local market. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. Shamshad wants to expand her business, therefore she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation to purchase three more baby goats. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to purchase three more baby goats

loans.name: Ashoki A Group

texts.en:
Asteria, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been selling shoes since 2006.  She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Asteria has had many other loans from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock of shoes and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with the loan, and appreciates Kiva for the support of their groups, which can now support their families and provide good education for their kids. She used the profit to pay school fees, build her house, and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy up-to-date shoes and meet her customers' requirements.  She dreams of opening another shop in a different area.  

Asteria will share this loan with her loan group Ashoki A, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date shoes and meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Ashoki  B Group

texts.en:
Linda, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still at school. She has been selling shoes since 2008.  She works from 6:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Linda's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her stock of shoes, and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date shoes and meet her customers' requirements.  She dreams of growing her shoe business.

Linda will share this loan with her loan group Ashoki B, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date shoes and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Batkhishig

texts.en:
Mr. Batkhishig, 41 years old, lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a transportation service between cities to people since 2005. His wife is currently staying at home, looking after their newborn child. Their other four children all go to secondary school.

The automobile that Mr. Batkhishig uses for transportation has been deteriorating over the years. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy spare parts to repair his car. As a result, he can continue to transport people without any problem.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Lkhagvadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvadorj, 41 years old, lives with his wife and son in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been transporting people between cities since 2005. His wife stays at home, taking care of household chores. Their son goes to secondary school. 

Mr. Lkhagvadorj's house has been deteriorating over the years. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam to renovate the house. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Emma  dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda, 53, is married with six adult-aged children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 22 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She received loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is re-applying for a loan for additional grocery items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Demeterio

texts.en: Demeterio is from Molave. He and his wife have a thousand seedlings of various fruits, and they earn a living farming and selling their seedlings. Recently, Demeterio received a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their land to plant on their own, and he hopes to yield more harvest to sell. Demeterio deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their land for farming.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory, 41, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Julius and they manage their household while operating a business. They work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lory operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a typical family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and meats costs less than raw food. Lory's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help Lory continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan to buy more ingredients such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lory hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan has entrenched his business. He was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase his inventory. The loan also helped him provide for his family’s daily needs.

Samson is very positive that he can further improve his business if you will lend him an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages. Samson's customers will likely buy more items if he has more of his products displayed in his store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will enable his business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, Samson could sustain the needs of his family.

Besides growing his business, Samson hopes that his family will have a more intimate relationship with the Lord as well as loving and respecting each other. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a married man who is 56 years old and has 16 children. Five of his children are still attending school. He lives in a rural area with the family and deals in a drug shop business. He supplements his income which he earns as healthy worker. He has been in business for 5 years and works all 7 days of the week, 14 hours per day. He started the business to improve his family's income and to get the school fee for the children, in addition to providing a service to the community.

He acquired the loan to restock drugs for the business. His clients are local residents from surrounding areas. His hope for the future is to build a big private hospital in the village. The challenge he faces is lack of enough capital for purchasing modern equipment and drugs. He describes himself as a honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy stock of human drugs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbike to transport her produce from the countryside to market

loans.name: Itahiro Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Wilson, a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda, is 47 years old. He started selling milk, piglets and coffee in 2005 to boost his income. He wishes to grow his business despite a lot of disease which attacks his piglets and brings about irregularities in his earnings. Wilson is requesting a loan to buy feed for his piglets.
