He is a member of Itahiro Tweimukye, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy feed for his piglets

loans.name: Ciciry

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Ciciry. She is a 43-year-old farmer from Kiamutugu village, situated in the Central province of Kenya. She lives together with her handsome husband and children on a small piece of land, where she keeps poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, her primary source of income has been eggs and horticultural produce. 

Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Ciciry made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. Sometime last month, she applied for a loan to expand her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. 

The additional income from the expansion will go to her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Ciciry's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Rose is 46 years old and not married. She has two sons and a daughter, who are still at school. For four years now, she has been running a poultry business in which she raises more than 100 broiler chicks. She works from 06am to 04pm daily, making sure her chicks and chickens get water and feed as required. She grows them from four to six weeks and then they are ready to sell. She makes a small return. This is due to poor sheds and a small number of chicks. To raise them in a good shed that has enough air and permanent power, she needs enough capital. To find a way to improve her business, she decided to approach Tujijenge Tanzania to look for financial support.

This is her seventh loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the past loans, paid back in full, to recover her number of chicks because she had a small number of chicks. She managed to buy feed for her poultry business. Rose earned a small profit, which she used to cover her family expenses. 
She will use her loan to buy chicks for her business. Rose will share this loan with her group, Mt Ulunguru, which totals three members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en: Mr. Erdenetsogt, 48 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He and his wife raise livestock and sell dairy products to local people. They want to expand their business by selling dairy products to neighboring city residents. Mr. Erdenetsogt is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants into the air and wastes less fuel. Moreover, the government encourages the use of electric cars and imposes less tax on users.

loans.use: to buy an electric car in order to transport goods to the neighboring city

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja con ganado bovino y en la agricultura; tiene 4 hijos, pero solo uno vive con ellos y trabaja, los otros estan acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares.

Reina, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto, lo ha hecho por mas de 4 años y lo aprendio de su padre, decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico extra y ayudar en el hogar.

Tambien, hace ventas de antojitos por las tardes.- Antes, solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar, la distancia donde tiene el ganado, está a 2 kilómetros de su casa y viaja a pie, la apoya su compañero de vida y un nieto.

Reina, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, esto mejorara mucho su negocio ya que podra tener más ganado.

Sus sueños son, ayudar a su familia y lograr sus sueños con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Reyna studied up until 2nd grade. She has a partner who works with cattle and in farming. She has 4 children, but only one of them lives with them and works. The others have partners and have their own homes. 

Reyna works with grazing cattle, and has done for more than 4 years. She learned the profession from her father, and decided to do it to make some extra economic income and help in the home.

She also sells snacks later in the day. Before, she only did household tasks. The cattle are 2 kilometres away from her house and she travels on foot. Her partner and one grandson help her.

Reyna needs a loan to buy grazing cattle. This will greatly improve her business as she will be able to have more cattle. 

She dreams of helping her family and achieving her dreams with the loan.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is a father of three children. He is the owner of a private advertising company. Depending on the customer needs, his company creates different advertisements and marketing tools. At the beginning, he started with a low investment in a small service, now he has managed to expand his company and offer a variety of different services to his clients. He has an employee who works for him and he is very busy. Mehdi is very happy with the income he earns, especially as his wife earns a small salary only with her employment in an electric company. 

Now, for the first time, he is in need of a loan to purchase new tools for his business, which will allow him to meet his clients' demands better and bring about a better quality of work. His goal for the future is to expand his company even more and see more success than he already has. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business that will better allow him to meet his clients' demands

loans.name: Mateos

texts.en:
Mateos is a 28-year-old married father of three children whose ages range from 1 to 7 years old. He has been photographed with the two oldest children. Mateos and his family live in the city of Korca, which has an extremely cold climate; sometimes it starts snowing heavily from the end of September until the end of April. The city is beautiful, though, with a rich tradition. 

Mateos is seeking a loan from you to make some repairs to the family home. To earn a living for his family, he has been collecting animal skins for a manufacturer who dries the animal hides and sells them to Germany. Mateos makes about $500/month net pay; his wife works a teacher for a net pay of $430/month.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to their family home where three young children live

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en:
Fetije is a mother of two boys. While her husband receives a pension, her son contributes to their family. One of her sons has recently opened a private car washing business. Fetije would like to help her son with his business, as it was she that suggested and supported him in starting his business in the first place. She really believes that the car wash has the potential to be very profitable and could satisfy the family needs from the income it generates. 

Fetijie is now requesting a loan in order to purchase a new machine to wash the cars. She knows that this investment will improve their business quality and help to satisfy their customers. She hopes that with her son’s contributions, they will be able to save money for the future. She promises to pay on time and is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to wash the cars.

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
The borrower, Faton, comes from the Ashkali community.  The Ashkali community is very poor and has a low economic status overall. It is often difficult for the members of this area to improve their status, and often in addition to their work, they need the assistance of loans. Most of the people in this community make a living by cutting firewood to sell for heating. Faton is very famous and unique because he is the only one in his area that fixes the machines for cutting wood. This makes him invaluable to the community and in much demand. 

Faton has a workshop in his house and he is very satisfied with his work and that he is able to support his family though this means. For the first time he is requesting a loan in order to purchase some new tools to repair his machine. He hopes that this loan will help him to be able to better serve his clients and reach his goal to expand his business, allowing him to eventually even sell the wood-cutting machines. He is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase some new tools to repair his machine for his business

loans.name: Shefki

texts.en:
Shefki comes from an Ashakli community. He lives with his wife and one son, as his other children are married and live in western European countries with their own families. He dislikes the idea of accepting or asking for money from his other children because they have their own families to provide for, so he works hard in order to earn a living and support himself and his family. He earns a living by cutting wood for heating, which he has done all of his life. 
From all of his years at work, his wood-cutting machine has become damaged and worn out. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new one. He hopes that this loan will help him to continue his business and even allow him to improve it. He promises to pay on time and thanks all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new woodcutting machine

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is a mother of four children. Her husband is employed by an electrical company, with a very low salary, so Bukurije had tried to work jobs late at night to add to their income, but it was very difficult. She was already caring for the home and children, and doing handicrafts during the day, so an additional job left her very tired and with no time. For 20 years she had been operating as a seamstress out of her home, adding to her family’s income in this manner, working hard to be able to give her children a better education. 

Bukurije is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She knows that a new machine will allow her to work easier and faster, and produce better quality products for her customers. She hopes that in this way, she will be able to increase her income and see more success. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is 49 years old and the father of four girls and three boys. He is involved in agriculture and currently has four cows, from whom he sells milk and milk products. There is a collection point that he brings his milk to, ensuring that he always has business and is able to make his sales. He also works on his land planting corn and wheat to sell. 

For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase another milk cow to capitalize on the demand for the products and improve his sales. He is very optimistic that in the future he will be able to further expand his farm and add more cows. His goal is to also start selling cows after he raises them. He is very grateful for the opportunity and is looking forward to a better future.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow, to capitalize on the demand for the products and improve his sales.

loans.name: Ljubisa

texts.en:
Ljubisa comes from one of the minority communities. As with all of these communities, the living conditions and standards are very poor and there is a high rate of unemployment. Liubisa currently works in a clinic in the area as a technician, but the salary is very low and not enough to provide for his family, including his three children between the ages of four and nine years old. His wife stays home to care for the children and the house, and therefore he provides the main source of income. 

Now, he has started a new business as a taxi driver. He still works at the clinic, but after hours he begins work with this taxi so that he can get the most amount of income for his family. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a vehicle that he will use for his taxi service. Between having both jobs, he is confident that he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family. He wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle that he will use for his taxi service

loans.name: Fraternite

texts.en:
Carole created a VSLA group in January 2013, thanks to a training received from an NGO.  After establishing the rules inside the group, she organized free participation for all members to elect the committee board. Sonel (middle) was elected treasurer and Civol (on the right), the secretary. 

Members are active and they have economic activity in the handcrafts sector for the most part. Today they need an additional cash to increase members' economic power through mutual solidarity.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for crafts for 30 members

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Applied Mathematics and Informatics. Here is her story:

“Until 2011, my family had a happy and carefree life. My father was an ecologist and my mother worked at the local market. That year, my mother had a stroke, which was followed by surgery. It seemed like our lives had stopped for a moment waiting for her recovery. Time passed and we were happy to see her improvements. Not long after that, I felt sick and twice had a head operation. From that day, I was forced to forget about some of my hobbies and activities at school such as math, running, chemistry, biology, basketball, dancing and so on. Thanks to God, I am good now and my health allows me to be active.

My mother’s health prevents her from working and she is a housewife. So my father is the only one with a full-time job in my family. We are four children: my elder two brothers, me and my little sister, who is still a schoolgirl. My brothers study at other universities and have part-time jobs in order to help my parents and to try to pay their university tuition by themselves. We live in a suburb of Bishkek and our house is really old. It is in need of repair but due to lack of money we aren’t able to repair it. When I was child, our house seemed big to me but now there is hardly enough place for everyone. We feel uncomfortable to have guests and wish to build a bigger house when we get better.

I thank Kiva lenders for giving me this great opportunity. I will try to study hard, not even for myself, but for my mother. I will do my best to keep her happy and not make her worry or upset because of me anymore.”

loans.use: to pay for her university education

loans.name: Combattant De Carrefour

texts.en:
Combattant De Carrefour is a branch of a community-based association in the south region of Port-au-Prince.  After having received an invitation from CARE NGO, the new branch was created as a VSLA group in December 2013. 

Most members are in the buy and sell sector. Women are street vendors. From left to right in the picture, Levy is the president. Denestant (middle) is the treasurer, and  Filonise (on the right) is the secretary. This group needs this loan to  renew its cycle of business transactions for 30 members.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cosmetics for 30 retailers

loans.name: Bold

texts.en: Mr. Bold, 33 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2011. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. Their son goes to secondary school. Using his previous loan, he renovated his house by installing vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to install an electric heater in his house. By doing this, he will further increase the heat-preservation capacity of his house. He will no longer burn coal for heating, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to install an electric heater in order to avoid coal usage

loans.name: Otgontamir

texts.en: Mr. Otgontamir, 30 years old, lives with his wife and son in an old house in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a serviceman at a power plant since 2011. His wife stays at home, looking after their newborn son. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car for taxi service. The advantage of the electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. He wants to use this environmentally friendly car for taxi service during his day off in order to generate additional income.

loans.use: to buy an electric car in order to render taxi service during his day off

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita, 62 years old, is a businesswoman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has run a small sari-sari (convenience store) in her place for more than 40 years. Angelita is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, biscuits, condiments, soap, detergents, beverages, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Angelita dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, biscuits, condiments, soap, detergents, beverages, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ashoki C Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early 40's, is married and has two children who are still in school. He has been selling shoes since 2009. He works from 6:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Joseph has borrowed many times from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to keep on increasing his stock of shoes and has managed to repay all of his loans successfully. Joseph is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for supporting his group, which is doing fine because of the loan. Joseph used his profits to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, to build his house and to cover his household expenses. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date shoes and meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of building another house in a different place.

Joseph will share this loan with his group "Ashoki C", which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date shoes and meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
She is Ma. Luisa. She sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her child and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 16,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Ma. Luisa aims to expand her business so that she can save more for her children's future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 53, resident of Bulacan, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her two children. She is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses.  She also manages their household while operating the business.

Lolita operates a soft broom retailing business. She sells soft brooms which are very common in the Philippines as they are used in cleaning the house. What she basically does is buy her products from wholesalers, and sell them per item with a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to grow and many customers will patronize her product. She dreams that all her children will finish their studies and have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy brooms to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 28 years, a female married with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes; she has been in that business for six years. She gets additional income from motorcycle transport. She has a dream of educating her children, and expanding her business. However, she is faced with the challenges of market competition and limited capital. 

Sylivia wants money to buy second hand trousers, skirts, shirts and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand trousers, skirts, shirts and other things

loans.name: Dubys Esther

texts.es:
Ella es Dubis una joven enérgica, impulsiva, tierna y emprendedora, es soltera con toda su vida por delante y quiere enfocar su esfuerzo en un negocio que desea iniciar el cual será una heladería pero que se salga de lo común, quiere llevar el ir por un helado a otro nivel, creando un ambiente de frescura y de sensación fría.
Por ello solicita un apoyo para poner en marcha este proyecto, necesita comprar enfriadores, ventiladores, sillas, mesas y surtido.
Apoya a una empresaria con ideas novedosas que busca tiene un medio de sostenimiento para sus padres y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
This is Dubys, an energetic, impulsive, loving and enterprising young woman. She is single with her whole life ahead of her and she wants to focus her efforts on starting a business. This will be an ice-cream shop, but one with a difference. She wants to offer another level of ice-cream, creating an atmosphere of freshness and cool sensations.

She is asking for help to start up this project. She needs to buy coolers, fans, chairs, tables and stock. 

Support an entrepreneur with innovative ideas who is searching for a way to support her parents and her studies.

loans.use: to set up her ice-cream business. It will be something a little different. She will use the loan to buy coolers, chairs, fans, and stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Realite Tete Ensemble

texts.en:
Eline (first on the left) is the president of a VSLA group. The group, under his leadership, has been assisting vulnerable women in helping them participate in their own economic development. Ginia (middle) is the secretary and Yvette (on the right) is the treasurer. 

Created in December 2013, this group has generated significant profits. Thanks to the training received, Eline leads the committee board with multi-background people such as saleswomen, accountants, and computer literate people. Today, they need additional investment to help 20 retailers. That's why they apply through Zafen.

loans.use: to buy sacks of food products for 20 retailers

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sor makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Chheang’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chheang makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Christ Capable

texts.en:
A Village Savings and Loan Association (VSLA) is a group of people who save together and take small loans from those savings. The activities of the group run in cycles of one year, after which the accumulated savings and the loan profits are distributed back to members. 

Pierre is leading a VSLA goup in the south of Port-au-Prince. The group was created in mid-December 2013. It established its rules and members are very active. Pierre(first on the left) is elected in the committee board, as president. Nikenson (in the middle) is the secretary and Jonny (the last on the right) is the tresurer. 

The group  closed its cycle of credit last month and hopes to find an additional investment for the new cycle. The group has 30 members. These are mostly retailers of hardware tools. Your contribution will help this group move forward.

loans.use: To purchase hardware tools for retailers in the group

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a 23-year-old single client who operates a spare parts shop, which he has done for over two years, as his sole source of income. Adam is a new client to the institution, and he applied for a loan of ugx.2,400,000 to buy a motorcycle for boda boda, so as to supplement his business income. 

Adam hopes to increase his income and meet his family's financial needs, since he takes care of his mother. 

Adam thanks Ugafode for supporting low income earners.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en:
Sarapio is an old client to the institution; he is married with six children, four of whom are attending school. He carries out a cattle trade as his major source of income, which he has done for 15 years. Sarapio has been taking loans from Ugafode, which has enabled him to build his first house and educate his children. 

He applied for a loan of ugx 2,000,000 to buy more cows to sell, so as to increase his income and be able to meet all his financial needs. 

Sarapio thanks Ugafode for its financial assistance, which has improved his family financially.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Union De Bois Dioute

texts.en:
A Village Savings and Loan Association (VSLA) is a group of people who save together and take small loans from those savings. Autilais created a group to help the poor in his community build their savings more easily while contributing to improving the security of their households. 

Autilais is the president ( on the left). Lignia (in the middle) is the treasurer and Monise (on the right) is the secretary. This group organizes weekly meetings with the community to tackle families' economic problems. Your contribution will help this group save more money and develop solidarity in the community.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for five seamstresses to retail.

loans.name: Tete Ensemble Bois Dioute

texts.en:
Tete Ensemble Bois Dioute was created in February 2013, under the leadership of  Delianne (on the right). Joseph (middle) is the treasurer, and Segu (on the left) is the secretary. 

Last year, Tete Ensemble Bois Dioute members supported medical fees for one of its sick members. This group plays a key role in assisting its members during hard times. 

Today, they are looking for a loan to allow members to sell natural medicines. The group received training  and supervision from an NGO. Your contribution will improve many families’ life conditions within the group.

loans.use: To purchase a grinder, plastic bottles, and raw materials for nine members

loans.name: Solidarite La Grenade

texts.en:
Solidarite La Grenade is a community-based organisation involved in social activity and a literacy program. In 2013, thirty people joined their forces to set up a VSLA group. 

Their committee board is composed of  Vilus (on the left) as president, Falone (middle) as the secretary, and Megene as treasurer. As all VSLAs, this group counts 30 members and it is supervised and pre-selected by an NGO in the sector. 

Your contribution will improve their life conditions while helping them gain more financial autonomy.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accesories for 12  members

loans.name: Gombotseren

texts.en: Mr. Gombotseren, 57 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting people between districts since 2004 using his microbus. His wife works as a conductor for him. Their daughter studies at college. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts in order to repair his microbus. Doing this will enable him to continue his transportation business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts in order to repair his microbus

loans.name: Tsogt-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Tsogt-Ochir, 46 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2012. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. Using his previous loan, he paid the tuition fee for his eldest daughter. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as fiberglass, bricks and cement for house renovation. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 35,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Bernadeth has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation.

loans.name: Celyn

texts.en:
Celyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Quezon City, Philippines. She is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.  She manages a retail store of footwear and hand tools and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. Reynante, her husband, works as a welder.  

Her products are footwear, sandals and other products of the like. She also sells different hand tools like pliers, hammer, screwdrivers and wrenches. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Celyn is requesting a loan to purchase additional shoes, sandals and tools to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales, and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of shoes, and sandals for women, and hand tools and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Mernoleth

texts.en: Mernoleth is managing her eatery business in Molave. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and also hopes to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is fifty years old, married with seven children and living in Kasese Uganda.

He sells crude salt and has been in business for ten years. He has a family dream of educating his children, however he has the challenges of limited capital and weather changes. George will use the loan to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell

loans.name: Rwanyakabogo Kweterana Group

texts.en: Lawrence is a 35-year-old, hardworking married man, with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices farming where he mainly grows watermelon alongside tomatoes as his main source of income. He started this business to educate his children and improve on their standard of living. He has hardships of poor climatic condition and inadequate capital; however, he hopes to expand his business and to educate his children to higher levels. He is requesting a loan to hire workers to dig his gardens.

loans.use: to hire workers to dig his gardens.

loans.name: Pafura

texts.en:
Pafura is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He has been a farmer for the past seven years. It is from this business that he has been able to sustain his family and take care of his schooling children. He faces a challenge of lack of capital, however he hopes to become a prominent business man.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido has been operating his own rental-housing business for years now, and he earns well from this. He is from Batasan Quezon City, 50 years of age, and is married to Lucia. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for his three children. Bienvenido and his wife are working hard with the determination of having more income than they currently have.

To improve his profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Bienvenido would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 50,000 could help him in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that his regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. He will also use a portion of the loan to add up to the capital needed for his pillow-making canteen business. He sincerely lets you know his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Bienvenido hopes that they could have more boarders who are trustworthy and disciplined. He also desires to start up other business for their additional income.

Bienvenido meets with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his rental house

loans.name: Yort's Group

texts.en: Yort’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yort makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 40, a married man in Molave, he runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day he never gets tired tending his store. Renato is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He religiously paid his obligations without records of default. Now, he borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores makes a good earning from her farming activities in Tambulig. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because she began to have a high cost of living when her children entered college. Dolores approached Paglaum to loan an amount needed to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 40-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kasese Uganda. Moses operates a textile shop of new clothes - a business he has operated for nine years. He has a dreamed of having a model boutique with the latest designs. However, he is faced with the challenge of market competition and limited capital. Moses needs a loan to buy clothes such as ladies' trousers, skirts, shoes and many other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as ladies' trousers, skirts, shoes and many other items to sell.

loans.name: Dorokasi

texts.en: Dorokasi used her previous loan to buy cassava flour to sell. Dorokasi is a hardworking woman. She is married with five children, and is living in Kasese Uganda. She sells cassava flour and has been in this business for three years. She also trades in goats in order to get additional income. She has a dream of expanding her business. However, she is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital. She will use the loan to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Ntuntu Mother's Group B

texts.en: Beatrice is a 48-year-old, hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop as her main source of income, alongside farming to earn extra income. She started this business to earn more income and look after her family. High rate of taxation, competition, and inadequate capital are her main problems; however, she has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer with educated children and an empowered family. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell like sugar, cooking oil, salt and others.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like sugar, cooking oil, salt and others.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for the past five years where he has been able to sustain his family and educate his children. He also practices farming to earn himself an extra income. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are his main challenges; however, he hopes to have an improved business. He is requesting a loan to buy more salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vito

texts.en:
Vito is a twenty-eight-year-old hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda who practices livestock selling as his main source of income alongside farming to earn extra income.

He started this business to earn more income and look after his family. High rate of taxation and inadequate capital are his main problems, however he has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer having an educated family.

Vito is requesting for a loan to buy more cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a fifty-four-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices farming where he grows beans, maize and coffee as his main source of income.

He started this business to educate his children and improve on their standard of living. He has hardships of poor climatic conditions and inadequate capital, however he hopes to expand his business and become rich.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 62-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas, and at the same time he has a retail and an agro input shop, which adds more income.

He faces challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. However, he has hopes of expanding his banana project to a large scale.

He has asked for a loan to buy onions for planting.

loans.use: to buy onions for planting.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 59-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a poultry farmer, rearing chickens and at the same time growing food crops like bananas and sugar cane.

He faces challenges of inadequate capital. However, he hopes to economically empower his household.

Samuel has asked for a loan to buy chicken feed for his poultry project.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for his poultry project.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used the previous loan to buy barbed wire and poles and to pay workers. He managed to protect his animals from disease, since he had already planned to graze them on his own farm where he can easily watch them closely.

Still in the same businesses of dairy farming and vegetable growing, John has been able to support his family.

John has asked for a loan to buy exotic cows so as to increase his dairy production and the related returns; plus, to buy barbed wire for fencing his farm.

loans.use: to buy exotic cows, and also barbed wire for fencing his farm.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been able to look after his family and educate his children from farming and livestock businesses.

Inadequate capital is his main problem, however he hopes to improve on his business to increase his income and become a prominent business man.

Henry needs a loan to buy manure and seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock alongside farming to earn an extra income.

He has been able to improve on his standard of living and have a better life. He faces the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations. He has a vision of owning a permanent house.

He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like cement for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement for his house

loans.name: Neerwaya 02 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA représente le groupe  NEERWATA 02 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 03 vont à l’école et il a 14 personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son village.
Il veut s’acheter 02 moutons.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mr ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Moussa represents the Neerwara 02 Sapone Group. He is married and a father of 4 children. The oldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. 3 of them go to school and he is responsible for 14 people. 

He has been raising livestock for 10 years. He gets his stock from his village. 
He wants to buy 2 sheep. 
He would like to reinvest his earnings back into his business. He strives to ensure schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep.

loans.name: Neerwaya 01 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr FRANCOIS représente le groupe  NEERWATA 01 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 03 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 03 vont à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 17ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 04 porcs.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut se réapprovisionner. Mr ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Francois represents the Neerwata 01 Sapone group. He is married and a father of 3 children. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. The 3 of them go to school and he is responsible for 4 people. 

He has been raising livestock for 17 years. He gets his stock from the surrounding markets. 
He wants to buy himself 4 pigs. 
With his earnings, he would like to restock. He is striving to ensure schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy 4 pigs.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, no estudió, está casado, su esposa trabaja en un destazo y en los oficios domésticos; tiene 3 hijos, pero no viven en casa con él, porque están casados y tienen sus propios hogares.

José, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de 30 años y lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y decidió hacerlo para buscar un ingreso económico, para sostener a su familia, también trabaja la agricultura y se dedica al destazo.- La distancia que camina para llegar a su lugar de trabajo es de 1 km.

José, con el crédito comprará ganado de repasto, esto mejorará mucho su negocio, ya que podrá tener más ganado.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José did not study. He is married. His wife works at a butcher and does domestic duties. He has three children but they do not live in his house. They are married and they have their own homes. 

José works with grazing livestock. He has done this work for more than 30 years. He learned on his own and decided to pursue it for an income to take care of his family. He also works in agriculture and butchering. He walks 1km to his place of work. 

José will purchase grazing livestock. He is improving his business a lot. Now he will be able to have more livestock. 

His dream is to continue working to improve what he can do in order to have a better future.

loans.use: purchase grazing livestock.

loans.name: Carlos Hugo

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de nacionalidad  colombiana, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con sus padres, con una hermana y una sobrina, comenta que se vino de Colombia ya que las personas que vivian por ese sector tuvieron que salir ya que se empero a apoderar la guerrilla, es de ahí que  son 15 años que  vive en Ecuador, aquí se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja de personal de aseo en un hotel, el crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos, la aspiración de Carlos es seguir trabajando para quedarse en Ecuador y buscar una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man of Colombian nationality. He is 24 and lives with his parents, one sister and one niece. He says that he came here from Colombia because the people in that area had to leave because of the guerilla groups. For this reason he has lived in Ecuador for 15 years. 

Here he works in farming and also works as a janitor in a hotel. He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and fungicides for his crops. Carlos aspires to continue working so that he can stay in Ecuador and search for a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi is 38 year old Ugandan married to Christine. They have four children aged 12, 9, 6, and 3. Two of them attend school. They reside in Kagadi town.

Abasi’s main business is transport. He drives on the Kagadi-Hoima road but he supplements this through farming. Abasi has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to repair his vehicle because it is not in good condition.

Abasi has a dream of buying a bus in future in order to develop his transport business so that he can increase his customer base and raise more income.

The major challenge that he faces in his business is the poor roads.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: In the year 2011, Jocelyn learned about Paglaum MPC and immediately signed up for her membership.  She is a farmer in Molave. She tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her rice production.  Jocelyn feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Jocelyn wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grains and condiments.

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en: Dindo has always had enthusiasm for farming. He has cultivated their rice land in Molave and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, he applied for a loan to  purchase fertilizer and pesticides. Dindo knew that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, he hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo has been considerably preparing for the post-harvest operations of his palay in Molave. He wants to ensure that he will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of his harvest to make way for another cropping season. He presented his proposal to Paglaum MPC and got a loan.  Maximo hopes to see all his children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is 27 years old, married and has three school-age children. The family lives in Polo Pitogo, Plaridel, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. This is how she supports her husband in earning a living for their family. The piglets' owners share in profit upon the sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional animal feed

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Perlinda

texts.en: Perlinda is 52 years old and lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. In order to help the family, she sells fruit salad. Aside from selling fruit salad, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2009, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. Now, she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling fruit salad is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send all her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia lives in Molave and supports her two children by building houses from the ground up. She has applied for a loan which she used to buy building material and paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paints, and pay her workers

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en: Maria Teresa is 37 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two school-aged children. Maria Teresa has been engaged in the nipa hut (a traditional stilt house) weaving and production business for 20 years already. At present she is engaged in a RTW (ready to wear) buy and sell business. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing these types of business activities, which is of a great help toward her family income. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of RTW's for sale. Maria Teresa has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Maria Teresa hopes to expand her nipa hut weaving and production business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stock of RTW's (ready to wears) for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is managing her rice farm, and she earns a meager income from it that primarily supports their family. She hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing, ceiling and walling. Rosa applied for an amount to purchase bags of cement, plywood, sand and gravel for her house renovation. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Rosa is very thankful that all her financing needs were supported by PMPC. Someday, she deeply wishes to live a happy and decent life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood, sand and gravel for her house renovation

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen used his previous loan to pay school fees for his brother. Stephen is twenty-eight years old, male, and single with no children. He lives in Kasese Uganda. Stephen is a banker by profession. He has been in banking for two years and he loves his profession. He has a dream of going for further studies. However, he is faced with the challenge of working for extra hours without any payment. Stephen has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his brother.

loans.use: to pay more school fees for his brother.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Telma Marilu

texts.es:
Telma, de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo trabaja con ganado bovino y también en la agricultura, tiene tres hijos. 

Telma, trabaja con ganado de repasto(bovino), lo ha hecho por más de 4 años y lo aprendió de su esposo.- Decidió hacerlo para contribuir un poco con los gastos del hogar.- Antes, solo se dedicaba a oficios domésticos.- La distancia que camina para llegar al lugar donde tiene el ganado es de 3 cuadras desde su casa, su esposo y uno de sus hijos le ayuda cuando no tiene clases, su horario es variado. 

Telma, utilizara el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto (bovino), esto mejorará su negocio, ya que tendrá más ingresos y eso le permitirá tener mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda y espera que sus hijos estén bien y se preparen académicamente, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Telma is 43 years old. She studied through the ninth grade. She is married. Her husband works with grazing cattle and agriculture. She has three children.

Telma works with grazing livestock. She has done this for more than four years and learned from her husband. She decided to do this to contribute something to the household expenses. Before this, she only did domestic duties. The distance she walks to the livestock is three blocks from her home. He husband helps and one of her children also helps when he does not have classes. His schedule changes. 

Telma will use the loan to purchase grazing livestock. This will improve her business. She will have more profits which will allow her to have a better quality of life. 

She dream is to be able to continue working. She hopes that her children are well and prepared academically so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: purchase grazing livestock.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. Of the five children, four are attending school and they are doing well. He deals in cocoa buying and selling as his major source of income. He hopes to educate his children to higher levels and finish constructing his house.
Herbert intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Francisca Guadalupe

texts.es:
Francisca, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en promocion social en una alcaldia, tiene dos hijas que viven en casa y estan estudiando.

Francisca, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de seis años y lo aprendió de su padre y de su esposo y lo hizo por motivos de buscar un ingreso económico para su familia.- Tambien, tiene una tienda y los fines de semana prepara ventas y se va con el equipo de futbol de su comunidad a vender.

La distancia donde tiene el ganado está a 1 km y viaja a pie, se involucra su esposo y su horario de trabajo es de todo el dia. 

Francisca, utilizara el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto, con el crédito mejorara su negocio ya que tendra más ganado y las condiciones de su negocio serán mejores.

Sus sueños son, poder seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia y que sus hijas estudien y se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Francisca studied through the 9th grade. She is married. Her husband works in community development in a town hall. She has two children living at home and studying.

Francisca works with grazing livestock. She has done this work for more than six years. She learned from her father and husband. She started as a way to make earnings for her family. She also has a store. On the weekends, she prepares and travels with her community's football team to make sales. 

The distance from home to her livestock is 1km. She travels on foot. She involves her husband and his work schedule which is all day. 

Francisca will use the loan to purchase grazing livestock. With the loan, she will improve her business. She will have more livestock and her business' condition will improve. 

Her dream is to be able to continue working so that she can give her family a better future. She also wants her daughters to study and be academically prepared.

loans.use: purchase grazing livestock.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a male Ugandan aged 42 years and married to Night. Together they have 4 children and three of them are in school.

Emmanuel is a cattle keeper but he also does farming, though on a small scale. He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy cattle for fattening. He will sell them later at a higher value and generate some profits.

His dream for the future is to buy land and put up a modern farm for his cattle rearing business.
The bigger challenge that he faces is bad weather, especially drought. He thanks Kiva lenders for the financial support through Ugafode and is committed to good repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is an old man of about 35 years. He lives with his wife and four children, both of whom are going to school.

He is involved in cattle fattening and trade; a project that he has been doing for over twenty years. Robert says his customers are basically cattle traders from his home area. According to him, through this business he has been able to provide everything for his family. Robert has been able to educate his children and also provide for his family's other essential necessities.

Robert acquired this facility to boost his cattle fattening business and farming. He says he is going to buy cows. He says, his biggest challenge are cattle diseases, such as foot and mouth disease, and a lack of enough capital to run his cattle trade business.

Robert is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything from his own strengths. He appreciates the work done by Ugafode to enable him with credit.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en: Matia used the previous loan to buy rice, soap, sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell. Matia managed to progress and earn profits which he used to pay workers at his farm. Matia is determined to take his business to greater heights by expanding and fully stocking it so as to meet the customers' demands plus increasing on his returns though he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Matia intends to use the loan to buy stock like cooking oil, salt, bread and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Ester has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Ester has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs, fertilizers and pesticides. Someday, Ester hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is twenty-seven years, female, and married with four children. She is living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been making shopping bags since 2009 and also sells fresh fish to get additional income in order to earn a living. She has a dream of making the highest quality shopping bags. However she is faced with the challenge of limited capital. She wants a loan to buy materials for making shopping bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials for making shopping bags to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 36-year-old single woman with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and sells food stuffs and other general merchandise. She works hard so that her family can get the basic needs of life. Despite all her efforts, she meets a hardship of price fluctuations of retail products. Her dream is giving her children the gift of education since that is all she can give them as a loving parent. She needs a loan to buy rice, sugar and other items to resell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and other items to sell.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana es una joven de tan solo 18 años que quiere darle un sentido laboral a su vida, en la foto se ve la mayor fuente inspiración y de amor que tiene su madre que se desempeña como peluquera. 
Eliana por su parte por lo que ha visto trabajar a su madre y sus capacitaciones quiere tener un servicio adicional el cual es manicura y pedicura.
Tu apoyo a esta joven puede darle un enorme impulso pues con lo que gane pagare el crédito, y pagara sus estudios universitarios.
Solicita formalmente un crédito para la compra de un módulo de manicura y pedicura, calentador e insumos.
texts.en:
Eliana is a young woman, only 18 years old, who wants to give herself a meaningful job in life. In the photo, there is her mother, Eliana's greatest source of inspiration and love in life, who works as a hairdresser. Eliana, having watched her mother work and for her capacities, wants to have an additional service which would be manicures and pedicures. 

Your support of this young woman could give her an enormous push. With what she earns, she will repay the loan and pay for her studies at university. She formally requests a loan for the purchase of a manicure and pedicure kit, a heater, and other inputs.

loans.use: to initiate her manicure and pedicure business and purchase equipment for manicures and pedicures, including a dryer and other inputs

loans.name: Richard-

texts.en:
Richard is a 25-yearold single man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in human medicine which he sells in his drug shop to supplement his income. He also earns money from a government salary. He is very hard working and has two drug shops. He hopes to buy land and build a residential house in town.

Richard intends to use the loan to buy medicines to sell.

loans.use: to buy human medicines to sell.

loans.name: Nyakashema Kwekamba Group

texts.en: Henry, a 52-year-old man started produce selling in 2010 to get returns and construct a big house in in Kagadi, Uganda. He is honest for the survival of his business. He is challenged by bad weather causing difficulties in transport. Henry intends to use credit to buy beans and maize for selling. He is a member of Nyakashema Kwekamba Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase supplies and utensils for  her food sales business.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo trabaja con ganado bovino y también trabaja haciendo viajes con un camión; tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven en casa y trabajan, los otros dos están acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares. 

Reina, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto, lo ha hecho por dos años y lo aprendió de su esposo, decidió hacerlo para ayudar un poco con los gastos del hogar.- También, cuida unas nietas, por lo que recibe un pago.

Tien una tienda en casa en la cual, le apoya su esposo y su horario es variado. 

Reina, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado bovino de repasto, con esto mejorará mucho su negocio, ya que podrá tener más ganado y por lo tanto le permitirá tener mejores ingresos.

Sus sueños son, poder trabajar muy duro, para poder tener un mejor futuro y el préstamo le ayudará mucho a lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Reina studied until sixth grade, is married, and her husband works with cattle and also works making trips with a truck. She has four children and of her children, only two live at home and work. The other two live with their partners and have their own homes. 

Reina works with grazing cattle, she has done so for two years and she learned it from her husband. She decided to do this to help a little with home expenses. She also takes care of a few of her granddaughters, for which she receives a payment. She has a shop in her home in which she helps her husband and her schedule varies. 

Reina needs the loan to purchase beef cattle for grazing. With this, she will improve her business a lot because she will be able to to have more cattle which will permit her to have greater earnings. Her dreams are to be able to work hard and to be able to have a better future and this loan will help her a lot to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy pastured beef cattle

loans.name: Neerwata 03 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr YAMBA représente le groupe  NEERWATA 03 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 13 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 10 vont à l’école et il a 17 personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’agriculture depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne dans la ville de Ouagadougou.
Il veut s’acheter 20m de grillage.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut faire de l’élevage. Mr ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yamba represents the Neerwata 03 Sapone group. He is married and a father of 13 children. The oldest is 25 years old and the oldest is 9 years old. 10 of them go to school and he is responsible for 17 people. 
He has been farming for 15 years. He gets his stock from the town of Ouagadougou. 
He wants to buy 20m of wired fencing. With his earnings, he would like to raise livestock. He would like to ensure his children's future.

loans.use: to buy 20m of wired fencing.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Reto Group

texts.es:
Johanna es la tesorera de un nuevo grupo en la comunidad de Suerres, en Jiménez de Pococí, está compuesto por 6 socias, que se dedican a las actividades comerciales y de servicios. 
Ella es una comerciante con mucha experiencia, inicio con su negocio ya que buscaba la manera de autoemplearse, y generar ingresos adicionales a su hogar sin tener que descuidar a sus 2 hijos pequeños. Su espíritu empresarial la llevo a emprender esta actividad, vende ropa para toda la familia, y utensilios plásticos para cocina, de forma ambulante en su comunidad y otras aledañas. La inversión de este crédito sera para reforzar su inventario, y poder cumplir con los pedidos que les realizan sus clientas. va a comprar comprar pantalones jeans, que vende muy bien. La aspiración de Johanna es tener una tienda,  ser independiente económicamente, y aportar ingresos adicionales a su hogar.
texts.en:
Johanna is the treasurer of a new group from the community of Suerres, in Jiménez de Pococí. This group is comprised of six members who work in the commerce and service sectors.

Johanna is an experienced saleswoman. She started her business as a way to employ herself and generate an additional income for her family without sacrificing the time she shares with her two small children. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, she started selling all kinds of clothes and kitchen utensils. She works as a street vendor where she lives and in surrounding areas.

With this loan, she will strengthen her inventory and be able to fulfill her customers’ orders. She will buy jeans, which get sold easily. Johanna would like to own a store, be financially independent, and contribute to her family with an additional income.

loans.use: to buy jeans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts

loans.name: Neerwata 04 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr FRANCOIS représente le groupe  NEERWATA 04 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 11 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Les 09 vont à l’école.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 20ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 01 motopompe.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut pouvoir agrandir son activité. Mr ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. François represents the Neerwata 04 Sapone group. He is married and the father of 11 children between the ages of 4 and 30 years old. Nine of his children go to school. 

He has been raising livestock for 20 years. He buys his supplies in the neighboring markets. 

He would like to buy one motor pump. With his profits, he would like to grow his business. He would like to secure his children's education.

loans.use: buy one motor pump.

loans.name: Hector Lupercio

texts.es: A sus 58 años de edad Hector es un señor viudo,  tiene 58 años de edad y  6 hijos mismos de los cuales 4  aun viven con el y una esta estudiando, Hector comenta que se quedo viudo y se hizo cargo de sus hijos solo pero con mecha responsabilidad, Hector se dedica  a la agricultura y a la crianza y comercialización de animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra de chanchos y de ganado vacuno, la aspiración de Hector es de seguir trabajando, mejorar su negocio y que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Hector, 58, is a widower. He has six children; four still live with him and a daughter goes to school. Hector said that when his wife died he took care of the children on his own. Hector works in agriculture, and fattening and selling animals.

With this loan, he will buy pigs and cows. His dream is to continue working, improve his business, and see his daughter graduating from school.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows to fatten.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan es un joven de 31 años de edad, el es de nacionalidad colombiana y ya son 10 años que vive en Ecualdor, vive con su hermana, cuñado y sobrinos, Juan se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a trabajar al jornal, el crédito lo necesita para comprar vaconas que las cria y luego las  comercializa teniendo alguna ganancia, lo que Juan aspira es mejorar su negocio y quedarse para siempre en Ecuador ya que aquí si hay donde trabajar y es posible comprar a futuro alguna propiedad.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old, and although he's from Colombia, he has for the past ten years lived in Ecuador with his sister, brother-in-law, and their children. 

Juan raises livestock, but also has a day job. He is applying for a loan to purchase cows that he'll raise and then sell to earn income. Juan hopes to improve his livestock business, and also to remain in Ecuador. He feels that there are more opportunities for work, and he thinks that he can some day purchase his own land in Ecuador.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domesticos, tiene dos hijos que viven con el, su mamá vive en su casa.

José, trabaja con ganado bovino, lo ha hecho por más de 6 años y decidio hacerlo cuando se casó y asi buscar un ingreso extra para su familia.- Tambien, trabaja en la agricultura y de ayudante de albañil.- La distancia que camina para llegar a donde tiene el ganado, está a 3 cuadras de su casa, en esto le apoya su esposa y la mamá.- Su horario de trabajo es variado.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, esto le ayudará ya que mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son, trabajar lo mejor que se pueda, para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
José studied until ninth grade and is married. His wife works in domestic jobs. He has two children that live with him and his mother lives in his house as well. 

José works with pastured beef cattle. He has done this for more than six years and he decided to do it when he married and was looking for extra income for his family. He also works in agriculture and as a bricklayer's assistant.

The distance that he walks to arrive at the place where he keeps the cattle is three blocks from his house and this supports his wife and his mother. His hours of work are variable.

José needs the loan to purchase more grazing cattle. This will help because it will improve his earnings and his quality of life. His dream is to work the best that he can to give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for grazing

loans.name: Arquimides

texts.es:
Arquimides, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está acompañado, su pareja trabaja en oficios domesticos y en venta de granos básicos en su hogar, tiene dos hijas, que viven en casa y estan estudiando.

Arquimides, trabaja en la compra y venta de granos básicos, lo ha hecho por más de 8 años y lo aprendió de su patrón.- Decidio hacerlo porque, solo con el sueldo de motorista no lograba cumplir con todos los compromisos.

Arquimides, sale a comprar granos básicos a los pueblos cercanos y viaja en pick up, le apoya su compañera de vida y su horario es de 6:00 a.m a 6:00 p.m de lunes a sabado. 

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar granos básicos para comercializarlos. 

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para poder darles el estudio a sus hijas y que tengan la oportunidad de prepararse academicamente, para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Arquimides studied until third grade and lives with his partner. She works in domestic jobs and in the sale of basic grains in their home. They have two children who live at home and are studying. 

Arquimides works in the purchase and sale of basic grains. He has done this for over eight years and he learned it from his boss. He decided to do this because with just the salary of a motorist, he could make enough to cover all of his commitments. 

Arquimides goes to buy basic grains in nearby towns and travels in a pickup truck. His partner supports him in the business and his schedule is 6:00 am to 6:00 pm, Monday through Saturday. 

This loan will be used to purchase basic grains to sell. Arquimides dreams are to continue working the best he can, to be able give his daughters schooling, and that he will have the opportunity to prepare himself academically so that he can have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt, chili peppers, and tomatoes

loans.name: Carmen Ofelia

texts.es: Carmen es una señora muy responsable, tiene 47 años de edad y sus 4 hijos están en las edades de 25, 22, 15 y 14 años de los cuales 2 están estudiando, también se hace cargo de su madre que es de la tercera edad,  su esposo se dedica  a trabajar a la agricultura y a la ganadería,  son 20 años que Carmen se dedica a la ganadería de vacas lecheras, el crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de una vaca lecher ya que comenta que es por medio del ordeño y la venta de leche es como obtiene sus ingresos, la aspiración de Carmen es comprar mas vacas y seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a responsible woman. She is 47 and has four children who are 25, 22, 15, and 14. Two of them go to school. She also takes care of her mother, who is of old age. Her husband works in agriculture and raising animals. Carmen has worked for twenty years with dairy cows.
