Il veut s’acheter 25m de grillage.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut  faire l’élevage. Mr ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. NINDA represents the group NEERWATA 05 SAPONE. A married man, he is the father of nineteen children. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 1. Six go to school, and he has thirteen  persons to support. Mr. NINDA  has been working in agriculture for thirty years. He gets his supplies from the town of Ouagadougou. He wants to purchase 25 meters of screens or lattice. With his profits, he wants to raise livestock. His ambition is to ensure his children’s schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to purchase 25 meters of screens or lattice.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is from Usocan, Plaridel in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. Luz manages a small fishing business.

She earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase new nets to be used by her husband in his fishing activity. 

In the future, Luz hopes to buy a new engine for her fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase new nets to be used by her husband for fishing.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 42 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is single and the breadwinner of her family. 

She started a business doing her hobby of baking cakes so that she can earn money as well. She accept orders and personally delivers the cakes. She has had this business for 25 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase ingredients and flavorings for her cake business. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Rosemarie wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and flavorings for her cake business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase loads of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tubers and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. Reyna espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is 31 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her partner and their three children in a rural area in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo Province. This community is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district goes about peacefully. The residents engage primarily in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Reyna raises and sells animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chicks, turkeys, and other livestock. Her business is located at her home. She has more than eight years of experience in this business. In addition, Reyna has good personal and work-related references who are from this area. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and other livestock. Reyna will also buy feed for fattening these animals. This investment will provide her with greater variety and increased productivity from her animals, which will have a great influence on her business.

Reyna hopes to increase her inventory of animals so that she can cater to the different tastes and needs of her customers who are in the area. As a result, she will generate more income and be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy hens, ducks, turkeys, and animal feed.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur Lamine est un célibataire sans enfants qui habite à coté du Guichet. Il est tailleur de profession et évolue dans la commercialisation des habillements et possède une boutique de prêt à porter au marché. Il sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Il n'a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l'institution et il prend toutes les charges familiales de ses parents et les frais de scolarité de ses frères et sœurs. Il s'active entre 9h et 22h. Ayant une expérience de plus de 10 ans, Lamine veut avoir des ateliers de broderie au niveau du centre commerciale pour mieux innover avec ses clients. Ainsi il pourra se marier et gérer sa propre famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine is unmarried and has no children. He lives next to the branch office. He is a tailor by trade and works at marketing clothing. He owns a store for ready-to-wear clothing at the market. 

He is requesting this amount to bolster his stock of merchandise and to diversify his products. He has no relatives benefiting from loans at the the microfinance institution, and he covers all the family expenses for his parents and the schooling costs for his brothers and sisters. He is active between 9 AM and 10 PM. 

With over ten years of experience, Lamine wants to have embroidering workshops at the commercial center, so as to innovate more with his customers. Thus, he will be able to get married and manage his own family.

loans.use: to purchase and resell clothing to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motor oil

loans.name: Neerwata 06 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr BENOIT représente le groupe  NEERWATA 06 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 21ans.  Personne ne à l’école et il a 05personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’agriculture depuis 35ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 01 motopompe.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut  faire l’élevage. Mr ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. BENOIT represents the group NEERWATA 06 SAPONE. A married man, he is the father of four children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 21. None goes to school. He has five persons to support. Mr. BENOIT has been working in agriculture for 35 years. He gets his supplies from nearby villages. He wants to purchase a motorized pump. With his profit, he wants to raise livestock. His ambition is to ensure his children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized pump

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tubs and the ingredients for making juice drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 65 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child who is now an adult. 

Helen has been earning an income from her monthly pension for almost five years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,900 each month as her regular monthly pension. She has requested a loan to be used to pay for the hospitalization of her granddaughter. Helen has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Helen hopes to engage in a business to add to her monthly income.

loans.use: To be used to pay for the hospitalization of her granddaughter

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their school age. 

Evelyn manages her own dried fish store at the public market. She’s been engaged in this business for 13 years already. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is so helpful to support her basic needs. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional stocks of dried fish for retail.
 
Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her dried fish vending business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of dried fish

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en: Marigen is 43 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children now at their school age. For their means of living, Marigen earns income from her eatery business, catering services and sari-sari (convenience) store. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for her retail store. Marigen has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Marigen hopes to expand her eatery and sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 63 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children now in their adult age. Rebecca earns a living from her little sari-sari store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She is also operating a motorcycle for hire. She's been in this business for 30 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from the business. Rebecca has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house renovations. Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 55 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children who are now at their adult and school ages. Susana earns a living from her little sari-sari store. She's been in this business for six years already. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of business and this amount is so helpful to meet the family's needs. She is also engaged in a hog-raising activity. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. Susana has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog-raising and sari-sari store businesses.

loans.use: To be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils, kettles, and teapots

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 56 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five adult children. Paulina has owned and managed their metal craft and welding shop business for 27 years already with her husband as the master welder. The couple earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repairs. Paulina has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Paulina hopes to expand their metal craft and welding shop business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repairs

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony thought of his good fortune when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned he could request financial assistance for his chosen business. Anthony has maintained his membership in good standing without any records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, he requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for his growing hogs. Anthony wishes to continue to manage his business more effectively with the support of his family. Someday, he hopes to repair his house and to provide his family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for his growing hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy sugar and fruit to make juice.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquin de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica desde hace 20 años al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, pesticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, para continuar con sus siembras y  tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Joaquin is 52 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and daughter. He has been growing corn and sorghum for 20 years. Joaquin sells his products in the areas surrounding his district. He already has established customers.

Joaquin is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, pesticides, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. This will enable him to continue planting so that he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María es originaria de Managua, vive en un barrio de Managua hace cuatro año, trabaja como secretaria ejecutiva en una institución del estado hace dieciséis año.
Doña Rosa María está solicitando un financiamiento para  comprar zinc, cemento  perlin para hacer un anexo de un cuarto ya que su familia va creciendo.

 Y agrádese el apoyo que le han brindado porque solo así he podido salido adelante y hacer mejora en su vivienda para bienestar mejora para su familia. y agradezco a  kiva y ceprodel
texts.en:
Rosa María is originally from Managua. She has been living in one of the neighborhoods in Managua for the past four years. Rosa María works as an executive secretary at a state institution. She has been in this position for 16 years.

Doña Rosa María is requesting a loan so that she can buy zinc sheets, cement, and beams so that she can build an extension to a room since her family is growing. She appreciates the support she has received because it is the only way for her to move forward and make improvements to her home for the welfare of her family. She expresses her thanks to Kiva and CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build an extension to a room.

loans.name: Elda Marleny

texts.es:
Elda, con la ayuda del préstamo anterior continúa con su negocio de venta de leña, mantiene a sus clientes satisfechos y ha logrado inscribir en la escuela a sus hijos.
Está necesitando de capital para comprar laminas y leña, construirá una nueva galera para evitar que en el invierno se moje la leña que ofrece a sus clientes, Elda está luchando por seguir progresando y cancelando sus deudas.
texts.en:
With the help of her previous loan, Elda was able to continue her business of selling firewood. She keeps her customers satisfied and was able to enroll her children in school.

Elda needs capital so that she can buy metal sheets and firewood. She will build a new shed to protect the firewood from moisture during the winter so that she can sell her product to her customers. Elda is striving to make progress and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to build a new storage shed.

loans.name: Mama Simona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina ella es soltera y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de carne, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Mama Simona”. The bank is located in the District of Poroy in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Sabina. She is 52 years old, single, and has three children. Sabina works at her restaurant business. She prepares different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and meat stir fry. Sabina works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream has always been to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The members who appear in the attached photos arrived after the meeting because they requested permission to be tardy for work reasons. The other group members engage in businesses such as selling animals, selling meat, managing a grocery store, and selling food.

Sabina appreciates those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payment according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es: Juana tiene 27 años de edad está soltera por ahora y está ejerciendo la Docencia en la institución educativa “LA SALLE” muy reconocida en su distrito, ya que termino sus estudios en la Universidad “la Cantuta” que inicio en el 2008 hasta el 2012 y ahora necesita titularse para poder obtener puestos de trabajo con más responsabilidad y poder crecer no solo en lo personal sino también profesionalmente, es por esto que empezara su curso de titulación en la Universidad, siendo este el objetivo del préstamo ya que lo usara en la compra de equipos de estudio y asesoría que demanda su profesión. Juana nos cuenta que una de las metas que tiene es tener una maestría en gestión y no solamente enseñar en los colegios sino también poder dirigir empresas reconocidas. Ella se siente muy contenta por el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA y a la vez pide que este apoyo siga continuando porque hay muchos chicos como ella que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juana is 27 years old and currently single. She is working as a teacher at La Salle educational establishment, which is very well-known in the area. Juana started her studies at the La Cantuta University in 2008 and finished them in 2012. She now needs to obtain her professional title in order to find jobs with more responsibility and to grow not just personally but professionally too. To do this, Juana will begin a course at the university and will use this loan to pay for study materials and assessments as required by her profession.

Juana tells us that one of her goals is to earn a Master’s in management and not just teach in schools but also manage large businesses.

Juana is very happy with this support from Kiva investors and hopes that it may continue as there are many young people like her who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to cover the costs to obtain her professional title.

loans.name: Mạo

texts.en:
Mạo is 42 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mạo works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Mạo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Mạo faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Mạo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 29 años de edad vive junta a su esposo y su hija en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. 
Catarina es una mujer que  se esmera en trabajar,  esto es con él afán de ayudar a su esposo para lograr tener sus patrimonios para el beneficio de su familia, Catarina hace un año logro colocar una pequeña venta de tamales y esta venta lo realiza en su comunidad, y por la calidad y el higiene  en su trabajo también saca pedidos, ella está muy feliz con este trabajo, ya que con este genera sus ingresos económicos. 

Catarina además de esta venta también tiene otras fuentes de ingresos ella cultiva frijol, maíz y tomate una parte lo consume y la otra lo vende,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y se dedica al trabajo las horas que sean necesarias, pues la meta de Catarina es construir su casa, con los ingresos que ella ha generado, se ha preocupado en comprar material poco a poco y ahora quiere empezar a construir una parte de la casa, para empezar con la construcción ella, solicita un prestamo en ADICLA. Los sueños de Catarina es construir su casa etapa por etapa hasta lograr lo que ella ha soñado. Catarina está muy segura que lograra este primer prestamo.
texts.en:
Catarina is 29 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan community.

Catarina is a woman who works very hard in order to help her husband to provide an inheritance for the family. A year ago, Catarina managed to open a small stall selling tamales in her local community. With clean and good quality products, Catarina has many orders. She is very happy with this work as it allows her to earn an income.

In addition to selling tamales, Catarina has other sources of income: she grows corn, beans and tomatoes, some of which she keeps for her own consumption and the rest of which she sells. Catarina is very hard-working and works as many hours as she needs to. Catarina’s goal is to build her own house. She has used her income gradually to buy materials and now she wants to start building part of the house. To start it, Catarina is applying for a loan from ADICLA.

Catarina’s dream is to build her house stage by stage until she completes it. Catarina is very confident that she can manage this loan.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy anti-pest treatments, manure, and potato and carrot seeds to sow.

loans.name: Zuurabu

texts.ru: Зуурабу 55 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У Зуурабу высшее образование, с 2006 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 30,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Зуурабу есть 3 коровы и 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Зуурабу составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зуурабу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Зуурабу сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Zuurabu is 55 years old, married and raising 4 children. Zuurabu has a higher education and has been involved in agriculture since 2006. She only had 30,000 som (KGS) of initial capital. Today Zuurabu's farm contains 3 cows and 10 sheep. Zuurabu's monthly profit amounts to 7,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zuurabu requested a loan in the amount 150,000 som (KGS) to buy calves to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will allow Zuurabu to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy additional calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Dzharkyn

texts.ru: Джаркын 54 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. В 2007 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 6 коров. Также на собственном земельном участке мерою 4,20 Га Джаркын выращивает картофель, клевер, кукурузу и помидоры для потребления и реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Джаркын обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Джаркын развить ее бизнес и накопить на ремонт и реконструкцию дома.
texts.en: Dzharkyn is 54 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She started her own business in fattening up livestock in 2007. Today, she has 6 cows on her farm. Also, Dzharkyn grows potatoes, clover, corn and tomatoes on 4.20 hectares of owned land for consumption and sale. Her combined monthly income amounts to about 25,000 som (KGS). Dzharkyn requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. The earnings from the loan will allow Dzharkyn to develop her business and save money to repair and reconstruct her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.ru:
Эту прекрасную женщину зовут Мукарама. Мукарама добрая женщина. Ей 46 лет. Мукарама замужем и имеет пять детей. Ее муж работает сварщиком. Сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Они не нашли себе работу на Родине и были вынуждены уехать, чтобы прокормить семью. Мукарама и ее семья трудятся, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и улучшить условия жизни. 
Мукарама занимается животноводством более 10 лет. В этой деятельности ей нравится сам процесс работы, она любит кормить поить и ухаживать за ними. Она держит скотин в своем коровнике. Ей в основном помогает муж. Мукарама обратилась за кредитом, потому что ей нужно купить мелко рогатого скота и продолжить деятельность и расширить бизнес животноводства. Она верить в Вас и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
The name of this wonderful woman is Mukarama. Mukarama is a kind woman. She is 46 years old. Mukarama is married and has five children. Her husband works as a welder. Her sons work in the Russian Federation. They could not find work in their native country and had to leave in order to support the family. Mukarama and her family work hard to earn money and improve their living conditions.

Mukarama has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. She likes the work process in this business, loves to feed and take care of the livestock. She keeps livestock in her cowshed. Her husband primarily helps her. Mukarama requested a loan because she needs to buy small livestock and continue and expand her animal husbandry business. She believes in You and hopes for Your help.

loans.use: to buy small livestock to continue and expand her animal husbandry business

loans.name: Jai Bharat Group

texts.en:
Mandara is 37 years old and lives in a rural village named Pipaldani in the Balangir district of Odisha, India. Pipaldani is a remotely located rural village. The lady standing third from left with her hand raised in the photograph is Mandara. She is a very active and energetic lady. She lives with her husband, one son of nine years and a daughter of four years in a small hut. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line category family. The main source of income for Mandara is vegetable vending, which she has been running for the last eight years. Mandara brings vegetables from the nearest town and with a head load, goes to the nearest villages for door step vending. Presently, she is earning around 3,000 INR per month from this business, which is very hard for her to manage her family and think of the future. So to diversify her business for future development, this year she, along with the other 10 like-minded women of her village, formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Jai Bharat to avail a loan from Mahashakti foundation. Mandara has decided to take a loan of 12,000 INR to purchase a piece of land for vegetable cultivation of her own. Her husband will manage the vegetable cultivation and she, in spite of procuring vegetables from the market, will sell her own products. She hopes this will help her to increase her income and help her to manage her family better than her present status. Mandara hopes to repair her house and give a better education to her children. 

The other 10 members of the group are also involved in businesses like vegetable cultivation, goat rearing, animal trading, general store etc.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for vegetable cultivation of her own.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Меерим 20 лет, замужем, есть двухгодовалый сын. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она 2 года назад стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Меерим достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Меерим имеется 1 лошадь. На арендованном участке мерою 0,80 Га она выращивает картофель для реализации. Меерим обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Меерим планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Meerim is 20 years old, married and has a two-year-old son. In search of a source of income for her family, she got involved in farming and animal husbandry 2 years ago. Thanks for her back-breaking labor and generous work, Meerim achieved good results in her work and started to earn a monthly profit in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Today, Meerim's farm contains her horse. She grows potatoes for sale on 0.80 hectares of land. Meerim requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two bulls. Meerim plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy two bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Janani Group

texts.en:
In December 2014, 10 women of a slum area from Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India formed a group named Janani (mother) to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Surabhi, a young and simple but confident lady, is one of them. She hails from a middle class family. The lady standing second from right in the photo raising her hand is Surabhi. She is 25 years of old and lives with her husband and two small children. 

Surabhi has been running a press paper plate making unit in her house for the last five years with the help and support of her husband. Now she has two paper plate pressing machines. She has engaged two workers to manage her business. She supplies her products to the retailers of the same town and other villages within a 10 mile radius. She purchases raw materials like paper and polythene from the nearest wholesale market 200 kilometers away on a monthly basis.  She gets a monthly income of 6,000 INR from the above business. Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. Due to the quality of her product and timely delivery, the demand of her unit is growing day by day. But to meet the demands of the customers, finances are a problem for her. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. With her present loan of 12,000 INR, Surabhi has planned to purchase another press machine and raw materials like paper roll, lamination paper etc. in bulk for the long term production and supply.  She is hopeful that this will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as well as generate more income by attracting more customers. Surabhi hopes to save enough to extend her existing house and better educate her children to lead a respectable life.
 
Out of the other nine members of the group, three members are doing vegetable vending, another four members are doing push cart services and two  members are running a tailoring center and a general store.

loans.use: To purchase another press machine and raw materials like paper roll, lamination paper etc. in bulk for long term production and supply.

loans.name: Sairam Group

texts.en:
Mita, the headstrong and confident single woman, is a permanent resident of Titilagarh town in the Balangir district in Odisha, India.  She is 35 years old and staying with her parents and one nephew. The lady standing on the extreme right in the photo raising her hand is Mita. 

Mita has been running a fast food center for the last six years. Aside from that, she also has a betel nut shop. In her center, she prepares chowmein (one type of food prepared out of noodles), samosa, vada, potato chips, etc., which are very popular in the locality.  She has engaged one boy to prepare these items.  Mita gets a monthly income of Rs. 5,000 from the above businesses. Out of this income, she can hardly manage her household expenses as well as the business investment. But she is happy that, being a single woman, she has never depended upon others for her livelihood. 

Mita has so many dreams like expansion of her fast food center and construction of a good house for her. But due to limited income, she has not been able to do so. Therefore in December 2014, she motivated 10 other women from her area and formed a group named Sairam to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. With the present loan, Mita wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, noodles etc. for her present business and purchase different types of fruit for starting a fruit stall. This will help her to generate more income and achieve her dreams. The other 10 members of the group are also running small enterprises like fish selling, a fancy store, a tailoring center, a dry wash center, egg selling, etc. and wants to develop them with their present loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of oil, dough, noodles etc for her present business and  to purchase different types of fruit to start a fruit stall business.

loans.name: Ambe Group

texts.en:
This group named Ambe was formed in December 2014 by 11 active and self-dependent women of Titilagarh town with an objective to avail a loan from Mahashakti foundation for developing their existing businesses. All the members of this group do their own businesses. Mathura is one of them. 

The lady standing third from left with her hand raised in the photo is Mathura. She is 34 years old and living with her husband and two sons. Mathura has been doing vegetable vending in the daily market of Titilagarh town for the last 10 years. She sells vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, brinjal, ladies finger, chili etc. She also supplies the vegetables to the small retailers of the same market. She regularly goes to the nearest wholesale market 200 kilometers away by train and brings back vegetables in bulk for supply and vending. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Mathura says, although she is earning a handsome income, it is not sufficient to maintain the family, invest in the business and materialize her dreams. So to get more income by expanding her business, Mathura has planned to purchase more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, brinjal, ladies finger, chili, etc. with the present loan amount. She hopes to save money for construction of a house and better education of her children.

The other members of her group are also doing small enterprises like vegetable vending, Tiffin center, general store and fish selling and with this loan, hope to enhance their livelihoods.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, brinjal, ladies finger, chili, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 12, Thôn 6+7, Trường Giang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thanh is 53 years old and married with three children. Thanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 12, Thôn 6+7, Trường Giang Solidarity Group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees. 

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years, selling to all types of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

She works at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell from her cart.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 27-year-old married man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. He has a small farm next to his house where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. He wants to improve the farm. 

Naser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more olive seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Naser will increase the farm productivity and also his income. 

Naser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is single and has six children who attend school. She operates a food stall, which she has been doing for eleven years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters. Hadjah requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 2,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, tomatoes, ground nuts, cassava, tomatoes,sweet potatoes, and onions. She hopes to start growing fruits and vegetables. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, ground nuts, cassava, tomatoes,sweet potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seven sheep

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a single mother of five children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She is a tailor and has been in this business for seventeen years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of cloth material and thread. She works from home six days a week and sells retail. She generates additional income from a payphone. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She aspires of educating her children up to university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of material and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the repayment expenses he has for his van.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a single mother of four children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family (a sister and her mother). She operates a restaurant and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more peas, flour, beans, beef, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to starting to growing peas. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more peas, flour, beans, beef, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a modern camera for her business.

loans.name: Zoher

texts.en:
Zoher is a 25-year-old single man from Jericho city. He has a blacksmith workshop in the city. It is a very good business and the income is high. Zoher would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Zoher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new machines for his blacksmith workshop. By taking this loan, Zoher will be able to increase his product quality. 

Zoher appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy new machines for his blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Kulusum

texts.en: Kulusum is married and has seven children who attend school. She has a business of selling green bananas, which she has been doing for five years. She sells on a retail basis five days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Kulusum requested a loan from MCDT SACCO for 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bunches of green bananas. She hopes to becoming a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house with access to electricity but does not have access to running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old single man from Rafah city. He has a learning center where he provide school students with ways to empower themselves with their school materials. It is a good business and he serves a good number of students. 

Ali would like to improve himself and now more about new methods of teaching. So he requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his educational center. 

Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his educational center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his new work.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for eleven years. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Susan has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, fish, beef, sweet potatoes, and cassava. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. Susan aspires to buy a fridge so as to start selling soft drinks. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. Susan resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, fish, beef, sweet potatoes, and cassava

loans.name: Dharitri Group

texts.en:
Patharla is a small village in Balangir district of Odisha, India. Most of the residents of this village are poor and belong to Schedule Tribe, Schedule Caste and Other Backward Classes. This village is surrounded by hills and natural rock plates, which is a blessing for the villagers to earn their livelihood. It helps because they prepare stone chips from the black granite stones of the hills and sell them to the builders to earn their livelihood.

Tapaswini is an inhabitant of this village. The lady standing with raised hand in the photo is Tapaswini. She is 32 and resides with her husband, one son and one daughter of 7 and 5 years old. The main source of income for Tapaswini is selling stone chips. Her husband wins tenders to supply chips to the contractors for construction of roads and buildings. She has engaged laborers for the preparation of stone chips. The stone chips prepared from the stone boulders are used inter-alia in the manufacture of concrete sleepers, construction of roads, bridges, buildings and other construction works. 

Tapaswini has been doing this business for the last ten years and the earnings mean life is just hand to mouth for her family. In spite of regular earnings she is not able to improve her living conditions. So to overcome this situation by expanding the supply of chips, in December 2014 she formed a Self Help Group (SHG) comprised of eleven members, to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Tapaswini took a loan of 16,000 INR and from this loan amount she is planning to pay the wages for the labourers and will purchase a big hammer, a small hammer and other materials for the preparation of stone chips. She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of constructing a house and giving a better life to her children. She has also dreams of purchasing a machine for preparation of stone chips and purchasing a four-wheeler.  

The other members of the group are doing small enterprises like General store, stone cutting, animal trading, vegetable cultivation and vending etc.

loans.use: To pay wages for the laborers and purchase a big hammer, a small hammer and other materials for the preparation of stone chips.

loans.name: Maa Singhabahini Group

texts.en:
Maa Singhabahini is a Self Help Group formed in December 2014 by eight active women entrepreneurs of Tetelkhunti village of Bolangir district in Odisha, India to avail themselves of a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. 

Tetelkhunti is a remotely located rural village situated about 100 kilometers away from the district headquarters Balangir. Manjukumari, the lady standing fourth from left with raised hand in the photograph, is one of them. Manjukumari is a very active lady of 47 years, lives with her husband, two sons and two daughters.

For the last five years, Manjukumari has been running a screen printing unit in her house with the help of her husband. She takes orders for printing of invitation cards from the nearly villages and also supplies ready-made invitation cards to the customers. She purchase materials like chemicals, paper, color etc from the nearest whole sale market of Bolangir. For supporting her in screen printing she has engaged one skilled worker. For her quality work and timely delivery she has name and fame in the locality. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR. 

Although there is very good demand for her work and it is now marriage season due to her scanty income she is not able to exploit the opportunities. Therefore she wants to expand her business by purchasing bulk quantities of cards, color and chemicals with the present loan to reduce the purchasing costs as she replenishes her stock frequently.  She hopes that this investment will support her to get a handful of income in future.  

Manuukumari hopes to construct a pucca house as the present house is a tile one and give better education to her children. The other members of the SHG are running general store, doing milk selling, cloth vending and vegetable cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of cards, colors, chemicals for screen printing.

loans.name: Tulashi Group

texts.en:
Arati is an active and confident lady from Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India. She is 43 years old and hails from a poor Schedule Caste family. Her family is comprised of her husband and two sons of 22 and 20 years old. Her family lives in a small mud house. Arati is standing on the extreme right with her hand raised in the photo. 

In December 2014 Arati along with other ten women of her hamlet formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Tulashi to avail themselves of a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their small enterprises. 

Arati herself has been running a Tiffin stall in her locality for last 12 years with the hand-holding support of her husband. Apart from that her husband also sells the Tiffin at the railway station. Her two sons help her in this business. Arati earns a monthly income of INR 5,000 from the above business. Out of this income she hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. As Arati says, now her children are grown up she has to think of their future but with the present little income she cannot do anything. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

From the present loan Arati wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar etc. so as to have a bigger production of Tiffin items. She hopes this will help her to add some extra income to start a new Tiffin stall for her elder son. Arati also hopes to save enough to build a good house and pay for the marriage of her sons. 

Among the other members 2 members are running general stores, 2 members have push cart Tiffin vending, 2 members have furniture service center,s 1 member is running a tent house and 3 members are doing vegetable vending.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar etc. so as to have a bigger production of Tiffin items.

loans.name: Trishakti Group

texts.en:
Hanita is 22 years old and lives in a Titilagarh town of Balangir district of Odisha, India. She hails from a Schedule caste poor family. She is a very active and energetic lady. She lives with her husband, and one son who is three years age in a small house of one of the slum areas of the town. The lady standing second from right with raised hand in the photograph is Hanita. 

The main source of income of Hanita is vegetable vending which she has been doing for the last three years. Hanita buys vegetable from the traders of the daily market in the town and with push cart goes to hamlets for vegetable vending. Presently she is earning around 4,000 INR per month from this business which means it is very hard for her to manage her family and establish a secure life. 

So to develop her business this year she, along with another nine like-minded women of her hamlet, formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Trishakti to avail themselves of a loan from Mahashakti foundation. Hanita has taken a loan of 12,000 INR to purchase a bulk quantity of vegetables to save her time, energy and ensure a better purchasing cost. She hopes this will help her to increase her income and help her to provide for her family better than the present status. Hanita dreams of constructing a house and giving better education to her children from her small savings.
 
Out of other nine members of the group, four members are doing vegetable vending, three members are running general stores, a fancy store and a tiffin center and other two members have chicken centers.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk quantity of vegetables to save her time, energy and prevent losses due to frequent purchasing.

loans.name: Shibani Group

texts.en:
Laxmipriya, about 33 years old, is an active married lady of the village Pipalpadar in the Balangir district of Odisha, India. She belongs to a schedule caste poor family. Her family comprises her husband, one daughter of 7 years and one son of 12 years. The lady standing second from right in the photo is Laxmipriya.

The main source of income of Laxmipriya is from an auto rickshaw service. Her husband has been doing this work for five years. Her husband is running the auto rickshaw in the nearest town Titilagarh. He works for 10 hours a day and earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR. With this scanty income Laxmipriya manages her family expenses, maintains the auto rickshaw and pays the tuition fees of her children. 

According to Laxmipriya, she has a dream for construction of a house, but the present income is so hand-to-mouth that she even could not think for the future. 

To earn some more income she and her husband have opted for another auto rickshaw. Therefore Laxmipriya motivated nine other women of her village and formed a Self Help Group (SHG) to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for developing their existing enterprises. Laxmipriya will use this loan for purchasing a new auto rickshaw by adding the required amount from her small savings. After purchasing the new rickshaw, she will hire out the old auto rickshaw. This will help her to generate some extra income and she will be able to complete the construction of her half-built house and give her children better education.

The other nine members of the SHG are doing rice vending, milk selling, vegetable vending and carpenter work.

loans.use: To pay for a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah. He is a father to one son. 

Haytham works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions so he decided to find an additional job.
 
Haytham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his new business. By taking this loan, Haytham will be able to transfer goods on it for the local traders and increase the family income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah. He is a father to two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Hasan wants to improve his family living conditions so he decided to find an additional job. Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his new business. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to transfer goods on it for the local traders and increase the family income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for sewing

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
Shaker is a 26-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah. He is the father of one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low income. Shaker wants to improve his family's living conditions so he has decided to find an additional job. 

Shaker took a $1600 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his new business. By taking this loan, Shaker hopes to be able to transfer goods for the local traders and increase the family's income. 

Shaker appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a thirty-one-year-old married man from Deir El Balah. He is a father of two sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Murad also works in transporting goods using his rickshaw.

Murad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to transfer for the local traders. By taking this loan, Murad will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Murad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to transfer for the local traders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various shop inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, floor bricks and labor to install the brick floor and plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, and a gate for the repair of the lavatory facilities and bath and to install a gate in the home.

loans.name: Mirando Al Exito Group

texts.es: La Sra. Jesika tiene 33 años de edad, esta conviviendo con el Sr. Wilmer quien es Electricista Automotriz y con quien tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ellos. Pertenece a la alcancía comunal “MIRANDO AL ÉXITO” donde recientemente obtuvo el cargo de presidenta ya que el grupo viene trabajando con nosotros por más de 2 años, conformado por 6 personas responsables y con muchas ganas de salir adelante mediante el apoyo entre ellos. Jesika tiene su negocio de venta de repuestos para carros apoyada por su conviviente, gracias a ello la calidad de vida que llevan ha ido mejorando y es por esto que el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar más repuestos para poder vender en su negocio que está creciendo. En la foto del grupo Jesika es quien se encuentra de pie junto a las demás personas sentadas.
texts.en:
Jesika is 33 years old and lives in a relationship with Wilmer who is an automobile electrician and with who she has 2 children who are dependent on her. She belongs to the “MIRANDO AL ÉXITO” communal bank where she recently became the president as this group has been working with Edaprospo for more than 2 years. It is made up of 6 responsible people who have a lot of desire to get ahead through supporting each other.

Jesika has a business selling spare parts for cars aided by her spouse. Thanks to this her quality of living has been improving. For this reason she will use the loan to invest in buying more parts to be able to sell in her business which is growing. In the group photo Jesika is standing beside the other people who are sitting down.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, bricks, sand, sheeting and nails to build an open air shed and an artisanal oven at her house.

loans.name: Barrio El Toril Group

texts.es:
Barrio El Toril es un grupo familiar conformado por dos matrimonios que han recibido el apoyo de VisionFund desde hace varios años y por lo cuál están muy agradecidos ya que en otras instituciones no les permitían crear una asociación con sus características. 

Doña Clara es una mujer muy simpática, siempre esta de buen humor y es muy trabajadora, tiene 45 años y está casada con Vicente. Ellos son padres de 5 hijos que ya no estudian pero aún viven en la misma casa. Clara y Vicente se dedican a la cría y engorda de cerdos y borregos desde hace tres años, para ellos es una muy buena opción para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar. Doña Clara es quien se encarga de cuidar a los animales principalmente mientras que Don Vicente trabaja en la capital del país. "Todo empezó porque uno de nuestros hijos compro un cerdito cierto día, creció muy bien y cuando lo vendimos las ganancias que obtuvimos fueron muy buenas”, después escuchamos hablar de VisionFund y decidimos ampliar nuestro criadero de animales. 

Con el primer préstamo la pareja compró algunos cerditos y borreguitos con sus vecinos y ahora necesitan invertir nuevamente en más borregos. Doña Clara está muy agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque han obtenido muy buenas ganancias gracias a su actividad y con ellas actualmente están arreglando su vivienda. Una de las metas de Doña Clara y Don Vicente es hacer más corrarles para tener más animales. Por su parte Don Antonio y María Agustina solicitan el préstamo para invertirlo en sus becerros.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio, detrás de los integrantes se puede observar la iglesia catlica. Doña Clara viste una playera verde*
texts.en:
Barrio El Toril consists of two married couples who have received the support of VisionFund for several years. The group members are all very grateful to VisionFund, which, unlike other institutions, was willing to work with them.  

Doña Clara, age 45 and married to Vicente, is one of the group members. She is a kind-hearted woman, always in a positive mood, and very industrious. The couple has five grown children who are no longer in school but still live with their parents. Clara and Vicente have raised pigs and sheep for the past three years, a business that has worked out well and allowed the couple to meet their household budget. Clara cares for the animals while Vicente works in Mexico City. 

Clara and Vicente first thought of raising livestock when one of their sons bought a piglet and the family was able to sell it for a good price when the animal was fully grown. Vicente and Clara then learned about VisionFund and decided to start raising livestock, obtaining a loan with their neighbors and using the funds to purchase some pigs and sheep. 

Clara and Vicente now need to purchase more sheep. Doña Clara is very grateful to both VisionFund and KIVA because the support of the two organizations have allowed her and her husband to earn steady income. They are now using some of that income for repairs to their home, and they hope to build more pens so that they can have more animals. 

Don Antonio and María Agustina, the other mamebrs of Barrio El Toril, will use their share of the loan funds for the purchase of calves.  

This photograph was taken in the town, and you can see the Catholic Church in the background. Doña Clara is the woman wearing the green blouse.*

loans.use: to purchase young sheep

location.town: La soledad, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Maria Elvidia

texts.es:
María, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y junto a su pareja tienen dos hijos, el primer hijo tiene 15 años de edad y su segundo hijo tiene 12 años de edad.- Su compañero de vida tuvo que viajar a los Estados Unidos, para poder apoyarlos económicamente.

María, se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace cinco años, ella sale todos los días a vender al mercado, para poder ayudar con los gastos de su familia.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que lo que tenía presupuestado no le alcanzo para terminarla y debido a eso necesita la ayuda del crédito.

El sueño de María, es tener su casa bien arregladita y seguir trabajando para poder apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and has a ninth-grade education. Her two sons are 15 and 12 years old, and their father left to work in the United States and send money back to support the family. María has for the past five years sold vegetables, going to a market each day so that she can earn income to meet her family's expenses. 

María needs funds to finish construction of her family's home and is therefore applying for a loan. The money she's been able to budget for the project is insufficient to finish the job. 

María hopes to finish setting up her home and keep working so that she can support her children and ensure their education.

loans.use: to finish construction of her home.

loans.name: Cfjdt 3 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT est un sous groupe de la Convention des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 5 personnes qui habitent tous dans le même village et pratiquent les mêmes activités. Leur présidente s'appelle madame Asba, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans l'agriculture et la vente des fruits et légumes . Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrants pour faire l'agriculture des céréales et ensuite faire la vente des fruits et légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Comme charges particulières, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. A l'avenir, elle souhaite avoir un champs de banane pour diversifier sa production. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter son revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: CFJDT is a secondary group of the Convention of Women and Young People for the Development of Tassette. It is made up of five people who all live in the same village and work in the same business. Their president is called Mrs. Asba, and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is married with children and works in farming and fruit and vegetable sales. She requests this sum of money to purchase seeds and products for the earth for growing cereals, and then to sell fruit and vegetables. She has over 10 years experience and she works  from nine o'clock in the morning to eight in the evening. Her particular expenses are those of helping her husband with the daily costs and school fees for their children. In the future, she hopes to have a field of bananas to diversify her production. Thus, she could increase her profits and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and products for the earth for growing cereals.

loans.name: Ericka Lucrecia

texts.es:
La búsqueda del bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida es lo que todo ser humano quiere, ante esto Erika, una joven de 26 años, cada día trabaja para lograr sus objetivos. Ella agradece a Kiva y Mi crédito ya que a través del beneficio crediticio que le han brindado ha podido surtir su pulpería con gaseosas, jugos, galletas y de esta forma ha obtenido mejores ganancias.

Una vez más Erika solicita el crédito para la compra de más producto para su venta tales como pan, sopas enlatadas y papel higiénico de esta manera ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. El crédito le ayudara a Erika a seguir teniendo mejores ganancias e invertir en la mejora de su hogar.
texts.en:
All people everywhere want to achieve comfort and a better quality of life, and Erika, aged 26, works and strives each day to achieve these goals. She is grateful to Kiva and to Mi Crédito as the support of these two organizations has allowed her to stock her grocery store with goods such as soda, juice, cookies, and thus boost her income. 

Erika is applying for another loan for the purchase of more goods for the store, such as bread, canned soup, and bathroom tissue. This investment will thus allow her to offer her customers a greater variety of products. With the additional income that this loan will help her earn, Erika will invest in improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store, such as bread, canned soup, and bathroom tissue.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y luchadora. Inició vendiendo verduras en el mercado para apoyar con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Con el tiempo, decidió poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la que le ha sido beneficiosa y lucrativa, pues ya no tiene que madrugar para trabajar fuera. 
Las aspiración de Rosa por ampliar su negocio son muchas, desea evolucionar a un mini súper, por esto solicita el crédito para comprar artículos de temporada como uniformes, cuadernos, lápices y demás productos escolares. También, surtirá su pulpería  para así  generar más ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa has always been a hard-working and determined woman. She started selling vegetables in the market to help with the economic expenses of her household. With time she decided to open a small store at her house. This has been beneficial and profitable and now she doesn't have to get up early and go out to work.  Rosa hopes to expand her business evolving into a mini-super market. So she is requesting a loan to buy seasonal items like school uniforms, notebooks, pencils and other school supplies. She will also stock her store so she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal items like school uniforms, notebooks, pencils and other school products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chilies, onion, radish, cilantro, tortillas, meat, canvas for her tricycle and new seats.

loans.name: Synia Yanira

texts.es:
Yanira, de 40 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera de 2 niños, uno tiene 7 años de edad y otro de 9 años de edad.

Yanira, desde que estaba muy pequeña ayudaba a su padre en el cultivo de maíz, luego se casó y su esposo se dedicó a esta misma actividad; no se le hiso difícil para ayudarle a su esposo, luego él la abandono y tuvo que trabajar para mantener a sus dos hijos.-

También, se dedica al cuido de animales de granja, su padre le ha dado 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, para que ella pueda cultivarla cada año, pagará parte del trabajo y como tiene experiencia en los cultivos, no se le hace difícil, pero tiene que madrugar ya que tiene que dejarle el desayuno listo a su hijo.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar  dos cerdos, ya que quiere tener un ingreso más para sus hijos.

Sus sueños son ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y en un futuro comprar vacas que le puedan generar ingresos en la venta de leche.
texts.en:
Yanira is 40 years old and the single mother of two children, ages seven and nine. She did not attend school. 

Yanira was very young when she began helping her father raise corn, and when she married, she found it easy to manage a farm with her husband. But Yanira's husband abandoned the family, leaving Yanira to raise her two children on her own. 

Yanira's father has given her a 7,000-square meter plot of land so she could continue to farm each year, and she also raises animals as well as corn. Yanira is an experienced farmer, so it's not difficult for her to manage the farm, but she has to get up very early each day and prepare breakfast for the children. 

Yanira will use the funds from this loan to purchase two pigs as she'd like to earn additional income for the support of her children. 

She hopes to help her children get an education and also to someday purchase cows that will provide milk that she can sell.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es:
Bremilda tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia en el caserío de Popan Alto - Zaña, una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno en la zona donde vive y en los alrededores, en la parte posterior de su domicilio cría animales menores que lo ofrece a sus clientes. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales menores como gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros, así como alimento balanceado para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, con esto Bremilda mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bremilda is 45 years old and lives with her partner and two underage children in their own home in the village of Popan Alto - Zaña, a rural area in the Cayaltí District, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade and animal husbandry. It is located in the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, in the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living from raising cattle in the area where she lives and its surroundings. In the back of her home she raises smaller animals than those she offers her customers. She has requested a loan to buy a greater quantity of small animals, such as chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs, among others, as well as balanced foot to fatten them up and so to generate a higher income. With this, Bremilda will improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals, such as chickens, ducks and guinea pigs, as well as balanced food to fatten them up

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 73 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, pero después se le hiso difícil y no pudo seguir, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya formaron sus propias familias.

Alejandro, se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, ya que su padre se dedicaba a esta misma actividad.- Hoy, cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en época de invierno, también se dedica a trabajar con bueyes, los utiliza cuando lo buscan para trasladar un producto hacia otro lugar, en lugares donde no pueden entrar  vehículos, esto lo hace en todo tiempo siempre y cuando lo soliciten.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar bueyes, ya que los necesita para transportar la cosecha que obtuvo y actualmente, no tiene medio de transporte para poder hacerlo.

Su sueño es comprar vacas para la venta de leche.
texts.en:
Alejandro, aged 73, studied until third grade, but then it became difficult for him and he was not able to continue. His life partner looks after household chores, and his children are grown up and have their own families.

Alejandro has worked in farming since he was very small, as his father work in the same profession. Today, he farms 14,000 square meters of corn during winter, and also works with oxen. He uses them for transporting produce to places which vehicles cannot access. He does this year round, as and when needed.

The loan funds will be used to buy oxen, since he needs them to transport his harvest, and currently has no means of transport to do so.

His dream is to buy cows so that he can sell milk.

loans.use: to buy oxen.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, de 26 años de edad, culmino sus estudios de educación media, está soltero y aún sigue estudiando su segundo año de contaduría púbica en la universidad, él se dedica a la agricultura y vive junto a su madre, su padre falleció hace 4 años.

David, desde que su padre falleció, tuvo que tomar las riendas de su hogar y empezó a trabajar en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijol, de esta forma es como obtiene ingresos para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar y también parte para para pagar sus estudios, ya cuenta con la ayuda de una beca de estudios.

El dinero de este crédito será para comprar ganado de repasto, el cual siempre compra después de sacar sus cultivos, para engordarlos, luego venderlos y empezar a trabajar en sus cultivos nuevamente.

El sueño de David, es graduarse de la Universidad con honores.
texts.en:
David is 26 years old and has completed his secondary school studies. He is single and continues to study in his second year of Public Accounting at university. He works in agriculture and lives with his mother. His father died 4 years ago.

Since his father died David has had to take charge of the house and began to work farming, planting corn and beans. In this way he makes money to help his family with the household expenses and also to pay part of his studies as he has the help of a scholarship.

The money from this loan will be used to buy cattle which he always buys once he harvests his crops. He will fatten them and then sell them and start to work his crops again. David's dream is to graduate from university with honors.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Manuel Isidro

texts.es:
Manuel es un campesino humilde y trabajador, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Actualmente posee cultivos de platano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.
Manuel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
El cultivo de Manuel Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Manuel is a humble and hardworking farmer, who was taught everything about working in the fields by his father when he was very young. 

He currently has banana crops, the harvest from which are collected and sold at the market in his village, which provides him with the resources he needs for his home's daily expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies wholesale (compost, pesticides, fertilizer), which will permit him to continue farming his crops and improve the yield of his next harvest, which will have a positive impact on his income he receives for each sale.

Manuel has expressed that his greatest desire is to keep fighting to build economic stability and provide his family with better living conditions and greater well-being.

Manuel will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to wholesale buy farming supplies, such as compost, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a selection of cosmetic and beauty products.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es: Noemy es una mujer de 49 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos de 20, 18, 16 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que demuestra su tenacidad al ganarse la vida cultivando productos como: ayote, güisquiles, frijol, maíz, chilipucas, etc., actividad que realiza desde muy joven ya que aprendió con sus padres este bonito oficio que le permite mantener la economía de su familia. El terreno en el cual Noemy tiene construida su vivienda se está lavando y ella teme que en este invierno sea peor, por lo que ha decidido construir un muro de contención el cual pueda proteger a su familia y sus pocas pertenencias, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: piedra, cemento, arena y grava para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda y de esta manera brindar más seguridad y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Noemy is a 49-year-old woman who lives in her own home with her 4 children, ages 20,18,16, and 9. She is a hardworking woman who displays her tenacity by making a living cultivating products such as pumpkin, squash, beans, corn, chilipuca beans, etc. She has been in this work since she was very young, as she learned with her parents this beautiful profession which enables her to maintain economic stability for her family.

The land where Noemy has built her home is washing away, and she fears that this winter will be worse. Therefore, she has decided to build a retaining wall which can protect her family and their little belongings. For this reason, Noemy is requesting a loan with FUSAI which will enable her to invest in stone, cement, sand, and gravel to build a retaining wall for her home, and give more security and a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, sand, and gravel in order to build a retaining wall for her home.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su  pequeña nieta. Marina se gana la vida por medio de la venta de productos por catalogo  desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y junto a su esposo quien es agricultor  mantienen la economía de su hogar. María desea construir un baño sanitario y de esta forma evitar focos de infección para ella y su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y pagará la mano de obra necesaria para la construcción del baño sanitario.
texts.en:
Marina is 49 years old, and she lives in her own home with her husband and young granddaughter. Marina has made a living selling products by catalog for a long time. She is an entrepreneurial woman, and her husband is a farmer, and together they handle the household finances.
